NARR: THE WATER DEPTH AT EACH STATION WAS MEASURED WITH THE SHIP ECHO SOUNDER. CORRECTIONS FOR THE DEPTH TRANSDUCER WERE APPLIED.

THE LENGTH OF WIRE LOWERING SAMPLING DEVICES WAS MEASURED WITH A METER WHEEL USING THE WATER SURFACE AS A REFERENCE LEVEL. WIRE-ANGLE CORRECTIONS WERE APPLIED WHENEVER CORRECTIONS WERE GREATER THAN ONE METRE.
VOLUME OF SAMPLE COLLECTED AND SUBSEQUENTLY EXTRACTED FOR TRACE ORGANIC CONTAMINANT ANALYSIS.
LOCATION OF SAMPLING DEPTH WITHIN TEMPERATURE PROFILE WHERE 1 IS IN EPILIMNION, 2 IS IN METALIMNION AND 3 IS IN HYPOLIMNION.

FULL_NAME: SHEAR LINES WITHIN 0.5 N.M. OF STN

NARR: SECCHI DEPTH IS THE DISAPPERANCE DEPTH OF A WHITE DISC 30 CENTIMETRES IN DIAMETER WHEN IT IS LOWERED SLOWLY INTO THE WATER.

SECCHI DISC IS LOWERED INTO THE WATER UNTIL IT JUST DISAPPEARS AND THEN BROUGHT UP UNTIL IT JUST BECOMES VISIBLE AGAIN. THE COLOUR OF THE WATER AGAINST THE WHITE BACKGROUND OF THE DISC IS COMPARED TO THE FOREL-ULE SCALE WHICH IS A SERIES OF 22 VIALS WITH GRADUATIONS OF COLOUR FROM DARK GREEN NO. 1 TO BROWN NO. 22.
HAZEN SCALE BRITISH DRUG HOUSE LOLIBOND NESSLERIZER WITH HAZEN COLOUR DISCS USED IN 1967.

ALL COLOUR MEASUREMENTS HAVE BEEN CARRIED OUT BY VISUAL OBSERVATIONS AGAINST THE SUBMERGED SECCHI DISC. IN THE YEARS 1960-64 A 2-DIGIT COLOUR CODE NUMBER WAS ENTERED INDICATING SUCH TWO-COLOUR DESCRIPTIONS AS GREEN BROWN ETC. IN 1964 THE FOREL-ULE COLOUR COMPARISON DEVICE

THE AUTOMATED DETERMINATION OF APPARENT COLOUR UTILIZES A PLATINUM- COBALT STANDARD. SINCE THE COLOUR OF WATER IS EXTREMELY PH DEPENDENT, AN UNFILTERED SAMPLE ALIQUOT IS MIXED WITH PHOSPHATE BUFFER SOLUTION WITH A PH OF 6.8 TO PROVIDE A CONSTANT PH FOR ITS DETERMINATION. THE ABSORBANCE OF THIS SAMPLE ALIQUOT IS PROPORTIONAL TO THE CONCENTRATION OF COLOUR AND IS MEASURED AT A WAVELENGTH OF 410 NM. THE COLOUR IS DETERMINED BY COMPARISON OF THE ABSORBANCE OUTPUT WITH THE FITTED CALIBRATION CURVE DRAWN FROM THE ABSORBANCE OUTPUTS OF SIMILARLY TREATED CALIBRATION STANDARD SOLUTIONS. A SLIGHT TURBIDITY CAN CAUSE THE APPARENT COLOUR TO BE NOTICEABLY HIGHER THAN THE TRUE COLOUR.

THE AUTOMATED DETERMINATION OF TRUE COLOUR UTILIZES A PLATINUM- COBALT STANDARD. SINCE THE COLOUR OF WATER IS EXTREMELY PH DEPENDENT, A FILTERED SAMPLE ALIQUOT IS MIXED WITH PHOSPHATE BUFFER SOLUTION WITH A PH OF 6.8 TO PROVIDE A CONSTANT PH FOR ITS DETERMINATION. THE ABSORBANCE OF THIS SAMPLE ALIQUOT IS PROPORTIONAL TO THE CONCENTRATION OF COLOUR AND IS MEASURED AT A WAVELENGTH OF 410 NM. THE COLOUR IS DETERMINED BY COMPARISON OF THE ABSORBANCE OUTPUT WITH THE FITTED CALIBRATION CURVE DRAWN FROM THE ABSORBANCE OUTPUTS OF SIMILARLY TREATED CALIBRATION STANDARD SOLUTIONS.
OCEANOGRAPHIC REVERSING THERMOMETERS. WILLIAMS,D.J. MANUAL OF METHODS FOR LIMNOLOGICAL OBSERVATIONS OF THE GREAT LAKES TECH. OPERATIONS SECTION,CCIW, BURLINGTON. 1971.

THE TEMPERATURE PROBE SI PART OF A MULTI-SENSOR PROFILER DESCRIBED IN IN OPERATING INSTRUCTIONS FOR THE WATER QUALITY PROFILER ES-88-001. TEMPERATURE PROFILES WERE BEGUN IN 1983 USING A YSI 524 NEEDLE PROBE. THE INTERFACE ABOARD IS CUSTOM. THE PROBE IS RECALIBRATED AT LEAST ONCE A YEAR IN THE STANDARDS LABORATORY. THE REGRESSION COEFFICIENTS ARE APPLIED TO THE DIGITIZER COUNTS TO OBTAIN THE FINAL READINGS. THE ELECTRONIC BATHYTHERMOGRAPH PROVIDES DIRECT INSTANTANEOUS READOUT AND GRAPHICAL RECORD OF TEMPERATURE VS DEPTH WILLIAMS D.J. MANUAL OF METHODS FOR LIMNOLOGICAL OBSERVATIONS OF THE GREAT LAKES CCIW., BURLINGTON., 1971. REVERSING THERMOMETER TEMPERATURES USED IN EXTRAPOLATING 9 POINT DIGITIZATION DATA HAVE 50 DEGREES ADDED TO INDICATE THAT THEY ARE NOT PART OF THE BT OR EBT PROFILE REPORTED.
THE ELECTRONIC BATHYTHERMOGRAPH PROVIDES A DIRECT INSTANTANEOUS READOUT AND GRAPHICAL RECORD OF TEMPERATURES VS DEPTH.

WATER TEMPERATURE READ FROM A BATHYTHERMOGRAPH PROFILE PRODUCED BY A MECHANICAL BATHYTHERMOGRAPH. REVERSING THERMOMETER TEMPERATURES USED IN EXTRAPOLATING 9 POINT DIGITIZATION DATA HAVE 50 DEGREES ADDED TO INDICATE THAT THEY ARE NOT PART OF THE BT OR EBT PROFILE REPORTED.
A TEMPERATURE CLASSIFICATION DENOTES THE AVERAGED DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE TWO SETS OF THERMOMETER READINGS. IT IS REPORTED ALONG WITH THE AVERAGED REVERSING THERMOMETER TEMPERATURE.

THE 5 DIGIT VALUE REPORTED CONSISTS OF 4 PARTS (READ LEFT TO RIGHT) FIRST DIGIT REFERS TO THE INSTRUMENT AND THE FIELD OF VIEW USED. I.E. 0 = XMS MARTEK WITH 2.3 F. O. V.      1 = XMS MARTEK WITH 0.9 F. O. V. SECOND DIGIT REFERS TO THE PATH LENGTH (0 = 1 METRE.,4 = .25,1 = .10) THIRD DIGIT REFERS TO THE FILTER USED (0 = WRATTEN 45 BLUE-GREEN ) FOURTH AND FIFTH DIGIT REFERS TO THE PERCENT TRANSMISSION. EXAMPLE 00075 REPORTS  75 PERCENT TRANSMISSION AT THE RECORDED DEPTH. PROFILES ARE TAKEN FROM SURFACE TO BOTTOM. READING OF 100 PERCENT WOULD BE OBTAINED IN HYPOTHETICAL NON ATTENUATING WATER.

THE CONDUCTIVITY PROBE IS PART OF A MULTI-SENSOR PROFILER DESCRIBED IN "OPERATING INSTRUCTIONS FOR THE WATER QUALITY PROFILER" ES-88-001. CONDUCTIVITY PROFILES WERE BEGUN IN 1986 USING THE TBI MODEL 465 PROBE AND THE 440 SELIES CONTROLLER. THIS INSTRUMENT IS RECALIBRATED AT LEAST ONCE A YEAR IN THE STANDARDS LAB AND ROUTINELY COMPARED TO READINGS TAKEN IN A SPECIAL BATH USING A HAND HELD HANNAH METER. THE SENSITIVITY CAN BE ADJUSTED BY THE OPERATOR USING COMPUTER ENTRY TO CHANGE THE REGRESSION SLOPE. THE REGRESSION ON COEFFICIENTS ARE APPLIED TO THE DIGITIZER COUNTS TO OBTAIN THE FINAL READINGS

SAMPLE IS TREATED WITH CONC. H2SO4, WASHED WITH DISTILLED WATER AND DRIED. DRIED SEDIMENT IS GROUND AND ANALYZED BY CHN ANALYSIS. DETECTION LIMIT 0.005%

FROM INTEGRATED WATER SAMPLE OTHERWISE CALLED ,RESIDUE, FIXED NON-FILTERABLE. THE SAMPLE IS FILTERED THROUGH A PREWEIGHTED GF/C FILTER. (PRECOMBUSTED AT 500 C.) THE FILTER PLUS RESIDUE IS DRIED, COMBUSTED, AT 550 C, COOLED AND THEN WEIGHED. THE SUSPENDED INORGANIC MATERIAL IS CALCULATED FROM THE DIFFERENCES IN WEIGHTS.
FROM AN INTEGRATED WATER SAMPLE. THE RESIDUE RETAINED BY A GF/C FILTER AND DRIED TO CONSTANT WEIGHT AT 105 DEGREES CENTIGRADE.

SEDIMENT SAMPLE IS ANALYZED BY CHN ANALYZER SEPARATE ALIQUOT OF THE SAME SAMPLE IS TREATED WITH CONC. H2SO4, WASHED WITH DISTILLED WATER DRIED AND ANALYZED BY CHN ANALYZER. THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN TREATED AND UNTREATED WILL BE TOTAL INORGANIC CARBON. DETECTION LIMIT IS .002 MG/L

AUTOMATED COLORIMETRIC, CADMIUM REDUCTION. THE SAMPLE IS MIXED WITH AN EDTA SOLUTION OF PH 6.5-7.0 AND PASSED THROUGH A COIL CONTAINING CADMIUM FILING WHERE THE NITRATE IN THE SAMPLE IS REDUCED TO NITRITE. THE RESULANT NITRITE, WHICH IS FORMED IN A 85-95% YIELD, IS DETERMINED BY BENDSCHNEIDER AND ROBINSON METHOD. REF: ANALYTICAL METHODS MANUAL, W.Q.B., I.W.D., OTTAWA 1979 PHILBERT AND TRAVERSY, INLAND WATERS BRANCH, CCIW., BURLINGTON. 1973. PROC. 16TH CONF. GREAT LAKES RES. 1973. PAGES 294-308.

AUTOMATED COLORIMETRIC, CADMIUM REDUCTION. A FILTERED SAMPLE IS AUTOCLAVED AND UNDERGOES A PERSULPHATE OXIDATION TO NO3 FOLLOWED BY A REDUCTION TO NO2, USING AN ALKALINE SOLUTION OF HYDRAZINE SULPHATE CONTAINING A COPPER CATALYST. THE STREAM IS THEN TREATED WITH SULFANILAMIDE AND N-1-NAPHTHYLETHYLENEDIAMINE DIHYDROCHLORIDE UNDER ACIDIC CONDITION TO FORM AN ANO DYE.

AN UNFILTERED SAMPLE IS AUTOCLAVED AND UNDERGOES A PERSULPHATE OXIDATION TO NO3 FOLLOWED BY A REDUCTION TO NO2, USING AN ALKALINE SOLUTION OF HYDRAZINE SULPHATE CONTAINING A COPPER CATALYST. THE STREAM IS THEN TREATED WITH SULFANILAMIDE AND N-1-NAPHTHYLETHYLENEDIAMINE DIHYDROCHLORIDE UNDER ACIDIC CONDITION TO FORM AN AZO DYE.

PARTICULATES ARE COLLECTED BY FILTERING SAMPLE THROUGH A MEMBRANE FILTER. PHOSPHATES ARE LEACHED FROM THE FILTER WITH ACID PERSULPHATE DIGESTION FOLLOWED BY AUTOMATED COLORIMETRIC MOLYBDATE STANNOUS CHLORIDE METHOD. REF: ANALYTICAL METHODS MANUAL, W.Q.B., I.W.D., OTTAWA 1979

SAMPLE WAS FIRST FILTERED THROUGH 0.45 MICRON MEMBRANE FILTERS AFTER WHICH SILICA WAS DETERMINED BY THE AUTOANALYZER HETEROPOLY-BLUE METHOD PHILBERT AND TRAVERSY, INLAND WATERS BRANCH, CCIW., BURLINGTON. 1973. PROC. 16TH CONF. GREAT LAKES RES. 1973. PAGES 294-308.

A DRIED,GROUND AND HOMOGENIZED SAMPLE IS WEIGHED IN A PORCELAIN CRUCIBLE,IGNITED AT 550 DEGREES C FOR 2 HOURS AND THE RESIDUE AFTER IGNITION IS DIGESTED FOR 16 HOURS AT ROOM TEMPERATURE (FROM 20-24 DEGREES C)WITH 1 N HYDROCHLORIC ACID. DETECTION OF PHOSPHATE IN THE DILUTE ACID EXTRACT IS BASED ON THE REACTION OF AMMONIUM MOLYBDATE WITH ORTHOPHOSPHATE TO FORM MOLYBDOPHOSPHORIC ACID, WHICH IS THEN REDUCED BY ASCORBIC ACID TO AN INTENSELY COLOURED HETEROPOLY MOLYBDOPHOSPHORIC ACID COMPLEX. THE COLOUR PRODUCED IS PROPORTIONAL TO THE ORTHOPHOSPHATE CONCENTRATION AND ITS QUANTITY IS MEASURED COLORIMETRICALLY AT 660 NM WAVELENGTH.

ATOMIC ABSORPTION SPECTROPHOTOMETER, AFTER SOLVENT EXTRACTION SPECIFIC TO THE METAL. 100 ML ALIQUOT OF THE UNFILTERED SAMPLE IS BOILED WITH 2 ML CONC. COLOURIMETRY ON TRAACS 800 AUTOANALYSER. SAMPLES ARE FILTERED THROUGH A 0.45 UM MEMBRANE FILTER IMMEDIATELY AFTER SAMPLING. THIS AUTOMATED PROCEDURE FOR THE DETERMINATION OF NITRATE AND NITRITE UTILIZES THE PROCEDURE WHEREBY NITRATE IS REDUCED TO NITRITE AT PH 55.5 (NH4CL-NH4OH BUFFER) IN A CU-CD REDUCER CELL. THE NITRITE REDUCED FROM NITRATE PLUS ANY FREE NITRITE PRESENT REACT UNDER ACIDIC CONDITIONS WITH SULFANILAMIDE TO FORM A DIAZO COMPOUND THAT THEN COUPLES WITH N-1-NAPHTHYLETHYLENEDIAMINE DIHYDROCHLORIDE TO FORM A REDDISH-PURPLE AZO DYE. THE INTENSITY OF THE DYE IS MEASURED SPECTROPHOTOMETRICALLY AT 520 NM. THE DETECTION LIMIT IS .005 MG/L

COLOURIMETRIC METHOD ON AUTOANALYSER TRAACS 800 WITH ALK. PHENOL. SAMPLES ARE FILTERED THROUGH A 0.45 UM MEMBRANE FILTER IMMEDIATELY AFTER SAMPLING. THE AUTOMATED PROCEDURE FOR THE DETERMINATION OF AMMONIA UTILIZES THE BERTHELOT REACTION IN WHICH THE FORMATION OF A BLUE COLOURED COMPOUND BELIEVED TO BE CLOSELY RELATED TO INDOPHENOL OCCURS WHEN THE SOLUTION OF AN AMMONIA SALT IS ADDED TO SODIUM PHENOXIDE, FOLLOWED BY THE ADDITION OF SODIUM HYPOCHLORITE. A SOLUTION OF POTASSIUM SODIUM TARTRATE AND SODIUM CITRATE IS ADDED TO THE SAMPLE STREAM TO ELIMINATE THE PRECIPITATION OF HYDROXIDE OF CALCIUM AND MAGNESIUM. THE RESULTING COLOUR IS MEASURED SPECTROPHOTOMETRICALLY AT 630 NM. THE DETECTION LIMIT IS .0015 MG/L

COLOURIMETRIC METHOD ON AUTOANALYSER TRAACS 800 WITH ALK. PHENOL. SAMPLES ARE FILTERED THROUGH A 0.45 UM MEMBRANE FILTER IMMEDIATELY AFTER SAMPLING. THE AUTOMATED PROCEDURE FOR THE DETERMINATION OF AMMONIA UTILIZES THE BERTHELOT REACTION IN WHICH THE FORMATION OF A BLUE COLOURED COMPOUND BELIEVED TO BE CLOSELY RELATED TO INDOPHENOL OCCURS WHEN THE SOLUTION OF AN AMMONIA SALT IS ADDED TO SODIUM PHENOXIDE, FOLLOWED BY THE ADDITION OF SODIUM HYPOCHLORITE. A SOLUTION OF POTASSIUM SODIUM TARTRATE AND SODIUM CITRATE IS ADDED TO THE SAMPLE STREAM TO ELIMINATE THE PRECIPITATION OF HYDROXIDE OF CALCIUM AND MAGNESIUM. THE RESULTING COLOUR IS MEASURED SPECTROPHOTOMETRICALLY AT 630 NM. THE DETECTION LIMIT IS .0015 MG/L.

COLOURIMETRY ON TRAACS 800 AUTOANALYSER. SAMPLES ARE FILTERED THROUGH A 0.45 UM MEMBRANE FILTER IMMEDIATELY AFTER SAMPLING. THIS AUTOMATED PROCEDURE FOR THE DETERMINATION OF NITRATE AND NITRITE UTILIZES THE PROCEDURE WHEREBY NITRATE IS REDUCED TO NITRATE AT PH 55.5 (NH4CL-NH4OH BUFFER) IN A CU-CD REACTOR CELL. THE NITRITE REDUCED FROM NITRATE PLUS ANY FREE NITRITE PRESENT REACT UNDER ACIDIC CONDITIONS WITH SULFANILAMIDE TO FORM A DIAZO COMPOUND THAT THEN COUPLES WITH N-1-NAPHTHYLETHYLENEDIAMINE DIHYDROCHLORIDE TO FORM A REDDISH-PURPLE AZO DYE. THE INTENSITY OF THE DYE IS MEASURED SPECTROPHOTOMETRICALLY AT 520 NM. THE DETECTION LIMIT IS .005 MG/L.

A FILTERED SAMPLE IS AUTOCLAVED AND UNDERGOES A PERSULPHATE OXIDATION TO NO3 FOLLOWED BY A REDUCTION TO N02, USING AN ALKALINE SOLUTION OF HYDRAZINE SULPHATE CONTAINING A COPPER CATALYST. THE STREAM IS THEN TREATED WITH SULFANILAMIDE AND N-1-NAPHTHYLETHYLENEDIAMINE DIHYDROCHLORIDE UNDER ACIDIC CONDITION TO FORM AN AZO DYE.

AN UNFILTERED SAMPLE IS AUTOCLAVED AND UNDERGOES A PERSULPHATE OXIDATION TO NO3 FOLLOWED BY A REDUCTION TO NO2, USING AN ALKALINE SOLUTION OF HYDRAZINE SULPHATE CONTAINING A COPPER CATALYST.THE STREAM IS THEN TREATED WITH SULFANILAMIDE AND N-1-NAPHTHYLETHYLENEDIAMINE DIHYDROCHLORIDE UNDER ACIDIC CONDITION TO FORM AN AZO DYE.

THE OXYGEN PROBE IS PART OF A MULTI-SENSOR PROFILER DESCRIBED IN "OPERATING INSTRUCTIONS FOR THE WATER QUALITY PROFILER" ES-88-001. OXYGEN PROFILES WERE BEGUN IN 1983 USING A YSI 5700 SERIES MEMBRANE CELL. THE INTERFACE BOARD IS CUSTOM. THE PROBE IS RECALIBRATED AT LEAST ONCE A DAY USING A SPECIAL AIR-SATURATED BATH AND A SET TEMP. THE SENSITIVITY IS COMPUTER ADJUSTED TO MATCH THE CALCULATED DISSOLVED OXYGEN. THE PROBE IS USED WITH THE YSI AGITATOR.

THE PH PROBE IS PART OF A MULTI-SENSOR PROFILER DESCRIBED IN "OPERATING INSTRUCTIONS FOR THE WATER QUALITY PROFILER" ES-88-001. PH PROFILES WERE BEGUN IN 1986 USING THE MARKSON MODEL 987B PRESSURE BALANCING COMBINATION ELECTRODES OR THE TBI MODEL 567 HIGH PRESSURE COMBINATION ELECTRODES. THE CALIBRATION COEFFICIENTS ARE OBTAINED AT LEAST ONCE A YEAR IN THE STANDARDS LAB AND THE READINGS FROM THE PROBE ARE CHECKED AGAINST AN INDEPENDENT METER OR BUFFER SOLUTIONS REGULARLY . THE REGRESSION COEFFICIENTS CANNOT BE ADJUSTED IN THE FIELD. THE COEFFICIENTS CAN BE READJUSTED LATER IN THE LABORATORY BY SOFTWARE TO ARRIVE AT THE FINAL VALUES. TEMPERATURE COMPENSATION IS INCLUDED FOR THE PROBE.

SEDIMENT SAMPLE IS EXTRACTED BY ULTRASONIC METHOD WITH ACETONE HEXANE MIXTURE (1:1), WHICH IS CONCENTRATED BY GOULDEN'S EVAPORATION COLUMN. CONCENTRATED EXTRACT IS CLEANED AND FRACTIONATED ON SILICA GEL COLUMN AND FRACTIONS A AND B ARE COLLECTED WITH HEXANE AND 1:1 MIXTURE OF DICHLOROMETHANE AND HEXANE AS ELUTING SOLVENTS. THESE FRACTIONS ARE CONCENTRATED BY GOULDEN'S EVAPORATION COLUMN AND ANALYSED BY GC-ECD.

A KNOWN QUANTITY OF WET SEDIMENT SAMPLE IS DRIED IN AN OVEN AT 105 DEGREES CENTIGRADE. THE LOSS IN WEIGHT IS MOISTURE AND FROM THAT PERCENT MOISTURE IS CALCULATED.
QUANTITATED TO 0.01 PPB BY GAS CHROMATOGRAPHY 2,4,5- TRICHLOROPHENOXYACETIC ACID. REF: ANALYTICAL METHODS MANUAL, W.Q.B., I.W.D., OTTAWA 1979
QUANTITATED TO 0.01 PPB BY GAS CHROMATOGRAPHY   2,4,5- TRICHLOROPHENOXY PROPIONIC ACID. REF: ANALYTICAL METHODS MANUAL, W.Q.B., I.W.D., OTTAWA 1979

QUANTITATED TO 0.05 PPB BY GAS CHROMATOGRAPHY 2-METHYL-4- CHLOROPHENOXY ACETIS ACID. REF: ANALYTICAL METHODS MANUAL, W.Q.B., I.W.D., OTTAWA 1979

A KNOWN QUANTITY OF WET SEDIMENT SAMPLE IS DRIED IN AN OVEN AT 105 DEGREES CENTIGRADE. FROM THE LOSS IN WEIGHT MOISTURE CONTENT IS DETERMINED FOR THE WET SEDIMENT.FROM THE WEIGHT OF WET SEDIMENT TAKEN, DRY WEIGHT IS CALCULATED AND THAT WEIGHT IS USED AS WEIGHT OF SAMPLE.

SAMPLES (LARGE VOLUME) ARE ACIDIFIED THEN EXTRACTED IN THE FIELD UTILIZING A GOULDEN VOLUME EXTRACTOR USING DICHLOROMETHANE. THE EXTRACTS ARE RETURNED TO THE LABORATORY TO BE DERIVATIZED WITH PENTAFLUOROBENZYL BROMIDE(PFBBR) TO THE CORRESPONDING ESTER, CLEANED UP AND THEN ANALYSED BY DUAL CAPILLARY GAS CHROMATOGRAPHY/ELECTRON CAPTURE DETECTION (GC/ECD) FOR 11 ACID HERBICIDES.

20-50L Whole water sample is extracted onboard ship by Goulden Large Volume Extractor. After concentration, DCM extract is cleaned and fractionated on silica-gel column-2 fractions, concentrated to a final volume of 1ml in iso-octane. Both fractions analyzed by GC.In 1986 - 1990, 37L processed on Erie and Ontario, 55L on Superior and Huron. Analysis performed by NLET; detection limit 0.3 ng/l

20-50L Whule water sample is extracted unbuard ship by Goulden Large Volume Extractor. After concentration, DCM extract is cleaned and fractionated on silica-gel column-2 fractions, concentrated to a final volume of 1mL in iso-octane. Both fractions analyzed by GC. In 1986 - 1990, 37L processed on Erie and Ontario, 55L on Superior and Huron. Analysis performed by NLET; detection limit 0.2 ng/L.

INTEGRATED NET HAUL FROM 100 M. DEPTH TO  SURFACE OR 2 M. OFF THE BOTTOM TO THE SURFACE. THE SAMPLING DEPTH FOR ANY STATION IS A WIRE ANGLE FUNCTION OF THE AMOUNT OF CABLE EXTENDED.THE LENGTH OF THE PLANKTON HAUL IS MULTIPLIED BY THE COSINE OF THE WIRE ANGLE TO OBTAIN THE EFFECTIVE MAXIMUM DEPTH OF THE PLANKTON NET

G.L.B.L.CCIW,BURLINGTON WARD + WHIPPLE 1945.BROOKS 1957 DEEVEY- DEEVEY 1971 DATA IS BASED ON VERTICAL NET HAULS FROM 2M.OFF THE BOTTOM OR 100 M MAXIMUM AND SAMPLES ARE PRESERVED IN 5% FORMALIN. STRATIFIED SUB- SAMPLING AND ENUMERATION PROCEDURES ARE USED TO COUNT A MINIMUM OF 25 REPRESENTATIVES OF EACH IDENTIFICATION GROUP IN A MAXIMUM OF 10% OF THE SAMPLE. TOTAL ABUNDANCE FIGURES ARE CALCULATED ON THE BASIS OF THE WATER VOLUME SAMPLED, AND RECORDED EXPONENTIALLY TO TWO SIGNIFICANT FIGURES.

STRATIFIED SUB- SAMPLING AND ENUMERATION PROCEDURES ARE USED TO COUNT A MINIMUM OF 25 REPRESENTATIVES OF EACH IDENTIFICATION GROUP IN A MAXIMUM OF 10% OF THE SAMPLE. TOTAL ABUNDANCE FIGURES ARE CALCULATED ON THE BASIS OF THE WATER VOLUME SAMPLED, AND RECORDED EXPONENTIALLY TO TWO SIGNIFICANT FIGURES.

TOTAL METAL ANALYSIS REQUIRES THE COMPLETE DESTRUCTION OF THE SAMPLE IN ORDER TO RELEASE ALL FORMS OF METAL. THE DECOMPOSITION OF THE SAMPLE IS ACHIEVED BY HEATING WITH A MIXTURE OF HF,HCL,HNO3 AND HCLO4 ACIDS. THE RESULTING SOLUTION IS ANALYSED BY ATOMIC ABSORPTION SPECTROSCOPY AFTER THE ADDITION, IN CERTAIN CASES, OF APPROPRIATE MATRIX MODIFIERS.

DISCRETE DEPTH SAMPLE. SAMPLE WAS FILTERED THROUGH 0.45 MICRON MILLIPORE FILTER AND STORED AT -20 C. CHL A WAS EXTRACTED IN THE DARK IN 10 MLS OF 90% ACETONE AT 3 C. FOR AT LEAST 16 HOURS. THE SAMPLE WAS CENTRIFUGED 10 MINUTES AT 5000G. SPECTROPHOTOMETRIC READINGS WERE TAKEN AT 7500A, 6630A, 6450A AND 6300A. CHL A (NOT CORRECTED FOR PHAEOPHYTINS) WAS CALCULATED USING THE SCORR UNESCO EQUATIONS. (STRICKLAND, J.D.H. AND PARSONS, T.R. 1968. A PRACTICAL HANDBOOK FOR SEA WATER ANALYSIS. BULL. FISH. RES. BD. CANADA 167.)

INORGANIC FORMS OF MERCURY ARE EXTRACTED AND ORGANIC FORMS OF MERCURY OXIDIZED BY DIGESTION WITH SULPHURIC ACID, NITRIC ACID, HYDROCHLORIC ACID, POTASSIUM PERMANGANATE AND PERTASSIUM PERSULPHATE. THE USE OF THIS PROCEDURE ENSURE THE TOTAL RECOVERY OF MERCURY FROM SEDIMENT WITH A VERY HIGH ORGANIC CONTENT. AFTER OXIDATION, HG++ IS REDUCED TO ELEMENTAL MERCURY IN AN AUTOMATED SYSTEM BY STANNOUS CHLORIDE. THE MERCURY IS SPARGED FROM THE SOLUTION WITH A STREAM OF AIR AND PASSED THROUGH AN ABSORPTION CELL SITUATED IN THE PATHWAY OF A MERCURY LAMP.

SAMPLE WATER IS POURED INTO PRE-PREPARED COLIPLATES TM. EACH PLATE CONSISTS OF 96 WELLS. THE PLATES ARE THEN INCUBATED FOR 24-30 HOURS AT 33-35 DEG. C. THE WELLS TURN A BLUE COLOUR DURING THE INCUBATION PERIOD. EACH BLUE WELL IS THEN COUNTED AND RECORDED. THIS IS THE TOTAL COLIFORM COUNT.THE NUMBERS ARE THEN READ ON THE MPN TABLE TO DETERMINE THE MOST PROBABLE NUMBER OF COLONY FORMING UNITS (CFU)/100 MLS.

FECAL COLIFORM DENSITIES WERE OBTAINED BY MEMBRANE FILTRATION. TECHNIQUES USING BACTO-M FC AGAR. MEMBRANES WERE INCUBATED IN 44.5 (PLUS OR MINUS .2 DEGREES CENTIGRADE) WATER BATH FOR 24 HOURS. AMER. TOTAL METAL ANALYSIS REQUIRES THE COMPLETE DESTRUCTION OF THE SAMPLE IN ORDER TO RELEASE ALL FORMS OF METAL. THE DECOMPOSITION OF THE SAMPLE IS ACHIEVED BY HEATING WITH A MIXTURE OF HF,HCL, HNO3 AND HCLO4 ACIDS. THE RESULTING SOLUTION IS ANALYSED BY ATOMIC ABSORPTION SPECTROSCOPY AFTER THE ADDITION, IN CERTAIN CASES, OF APPROPRIATE MATRIC MODIFIERS.

BACTO-PLATE COUNT AGAR WAS THE MEDIUM USED.TOTAL VIABLE COUNTS WERE READ AT 48+3 HOURS FOR PLATES INCUBATED AT 20DEG.C COUNTS WERE CALCULATED AND RECORDED AS STANDARD PLATE COUNTS PER ML OF WATER AT THE SPECIFIED TEMPERATURE. STANDARD PHOTOMETRIC PROCEDURE.  IMPROVED METHOD FOR QUANTITATIVE MEASUREMENT OF ATP IN LAKE WATERS. B.K. AFGHAN ET.AL.(1976) C.C.I.W. UNPUBLISHED REPORT.
STANDARD PHOTOMETRIC PROCEDURE. IMPROVED METHOD FOR QUANTITATIVE MEASUREMENTS OF ATP IN LAKE WATERS. B.K.AFGHAN ET.AL.(1976) C.C.I.W., UNPUBLISHED REPORT

SAMPLES ARE EXTRACTED IN THE FIELD USING THE GOULDEN LARGE VOLUME EXTRACTOR UTILIZING DICHLOROMETHANE AS THE EXTRACTANT.ONCE IN THE LAB, THE WATER IS SEPARATED FROM THE DCM AND THE SOLVENT IS DRIED USING SODIUM SULPHATE. THIS IS THEN CONCENTRATED TO APPROXIMATLEY 2 ML. THE EXTRACT IS CLEANED UP ON A 10 GM FLORISIL COLUMN (10% DEACTIVATED) AND 2 FRACTIONS ARE COLLECTED. THE SOLVENTS ARE EXCHANGED FOR ISOOCTANE AND THE FINAL VOLUME OF THE EXTRACTS IS 10 ML. BOTH FRACTIONS ARE ANALYZED ON DUAL CAPILLARY GC/ECD. FRACTION B IS THEN CONCENTRATED UNDER NITROGEN TO A FINAL VOLUME OF 1.0 ML AND THIS IS ANALYZED BY GC/NPD.

SEDIMENT SAMPLES ARE EXTRACTED ULTRASONICALLY USING ACETONE:HEXANE (1:1) MIXTURE. THE EXTRACT IS PARTITIONED WITH WATER AND BACK EXTRACTED WITH DICHLOROMETHANE. THE COMBINED EXTRACT IS CONCENTRATED, CLEANED UP AND FRACTIONATED ON 20 GM OF 10% DEACTIVATED FLORISIL. TWO FRACTIONS ARE COLLECTED AND ARE ANALYZED BY GC/ECD AND GC/NPD.

SAMPLES ARE EXTRACTED IN THE FIELD USING THE GOULDEN LARGE VOLUME EXTRACTOR UTILIZING DICHLOROMETHANE AS THE EXTRACTANT.ONCE IN THE LAB, THE WATER IS SEPARATED FROM THE DCM AND THE SOLVENT IS DRIED USING SODIUM SULPHATE. THIS IS THEN CONCENTRATED TO APPROXIMATELY 2 ML. THE EXTRACT IS CLEANED UP ON A 10 GM FLORISIL COLUMN (10% DEACTIVATED)AND 2 FRACTIONS ARE COLLECTED. THE SOLVENTS ARE EXCHANGED FRO ISOOCTANE AND THE FINAL VOLUME OF THE EXTRACTS IS 10 ML. BOTH FRACTIONS ARE ANALYZED ON DUAL CAPILLARY GC/ECD. FRACTION B IS THEN CONCENTRATED UNDER NITROGEN TO A FINAL VOLUME OF 1.0 ML AND THIS IS ANALYZED BY GC/NPD.

SEDIMENT SAMPLES ARE EXTRACTED ULTRASONICALLY USING ACETONE:HEXANE (1:1) MIXTURE. THE EXTRACT IS PARTITIONED WITH WATER AND BACK EXTRACTED WITH DICHLOROMETHANE. THE COMBINED EXTRACT IS CONCENTRATED, CLEANED UP AND FRACTIONATED ON 20 GM OF 10% DEACTIVATED FLORISIL. TWO FRACTIONS ARE COLLECTED AND ARE ANALYZED BY GC/ECD AND GC/NPD.

THE COMBINED EXTRACT IS CONCENTRATED, CLEANED UP AND FRACTIONATED ON 20 GM OF 10% DEACTIVATED FLORISIL. TWO FRACTIONS ARE COLLECTED AND ARE ANALYZED BY GC/ECD AND GC/NPD.

SEDIMENT SAMPLES ARE EXTRACTED ULTRASONICALLY USING ACETONE:HEXANE (1:1) MIXTURE. THE EXTRACT IS PARTITIONED WITH WATER AND BACK EXTRACTED WITH DICHLOROMETHANE. THE COMBINED EXTRACT IS CONCENTRATED, CLEANED UP AND FRACTIONATED ON 20 GM OF 10% DEACTIVATED FLORISIL. TWO FRACTIONS ARE COLLECTED AND ARE ANALYZED BY GC/ECD AND GC/NPD.

SAMPLES ARE EXTRACTED IN THE FIELD USING THE GOULDEN LARGE VOLUME EXTRACTOR UTILIZING DICHLOROMETHANE AS THE EXTRACTANT.ONCE IN THE LAB, THE WATER IS SEPARATED FROM THE DCM AND THE SOLVENT IS DRIED USING SODIUM SULPHATE. THIS IS THEN CONCENTRATED TO APPROXIMATELY 2 ML. THE EXTRACT IS CLEANED UP ON A 10 GM FLORISIL COLUMN (10% DEACTIVATED) AND 2 FRACTIONS ARE COLLECTED.THE SOLVENTS ARE EXCHANGED FOR ISOOCTANE AND THE FINAL VOLUME OF THE EXTRACTS IS 10 ML. BOTH FRACTIONS ARE ANALYZED ON DUAL CAPILLARY GC/ECD. FRACTION B IS THEN CONCENTRATED UNDER NITROGEN TO A FINAL VOLUME OF 1.0 ML AND THIS IS ANALYZED BY GC/NPD.

SAMPLES (LARGE VOLUME) ARE ACIDIFIED THEN EXTRACTED IN THE FIELD UTILIZING A GOULDEN LARGE VOLUME EXTRACTOR USING DICHLOROMETHANE. THE EXTRACTS ARE RETURNED TO THE LABORATORY TO BE DERIVATIZED WITH PENTAFLUOROBENZYL BROMIDE (PFBBR) TO THE CORRESPONDING ESTER, CLEANED UP AND THEN ANALYSED BY DUAL CAPILLARY GAS CHROMATOGRAPHY/ELECTRON CAPTURE DETECTION (GC/ECD) FOR 11 ACID HERBICIDES.

THE RESIDUE THAT REMAINS AFTER THE COMPLETION OF TEST FOR NON-FILTERABLE RESIDUE (METHOD 1835) IS IGNITED IN A MUFFLE FURNACE AT 550 DEG. C. FOR 1 HOUR. THE DISH CONTAINING THE FILTER IS REMOVED FROM THE FURNACE, COOLED FOR 15 MINUTES IN A DESICATOR, AND WEIGHED TO A CONSTANT WEIGHT.

THE SAMPLE ALIGNOT IS FILTERED THROUGH A PRE-IGNITED WHATMAN GF/C FILTER. THE FILTRATE IS COLLECTED IN A BEAKER AND POURED INTO A PRE-IGNITED AND PRE-WEIGHED PORCELAIN DISH. THE FILTRATE IS SLOWLY EVAPORATED ON A WATER BATH, AFTER PERFORMING TEST FOR FILTERABLE RESIDUE (METHOD 1835), THE DISH IS IGNITED IN A MUFFLE FURNACE AT 550 DEG.C. FOR 30 MINUTES. THE DISH IS THEN COOLED IN A DESICCATOR FOR 30 MINUTES AND WEIGHED TO A CONSTANT WEIGHT.

INDUCTIVELY COUPLED ARGON PLASMA-OPTICAL EMISSION SPECTROMETRY- (ICP-OES) EXTERNAL NEBULIZER. SAMPLES PRESERVED WITH 2 ML CONC. HNO3 PER LITER. A SAMPLE ALIQUOT IS DIGESTED AND EVAPORATED TO NEAR DRYNESS. THE RESIDUE IS DIGESTED WITH CONC. HCL TO NEAR DRYNESS. THE RESIDUE IS DISSOLVED IN ONE-TENTH OF THE ALIQUOT VOLUME OF DEIONIZED WATER. THE EMISSION IS MEASURED SPECTROPHOTOMETRICALLY AND COMPARED WITH STANDARD SOLUTIONS. ALUMINUM: 308.2 NM

METALS,EXTRACTABLE,INDUCTIVELY COUPLED PLASMA - MASS SPECTROMETRY - (ICP-MS): A WATER SAMPLE IS COLLECTED UNFILTERED AND PRESERVED IN 0.2 PERCENT NITRIC ACID. A DECANTED PORTION OF THE SAMPLE IS INTRODUCED DIRECTLY INTO A RADIOFREQUENCY ARGON PLASMA BY PNEUMATIC NEBULIZATION. THE IONS PRODUCED ARE TRANSPORTED TO THE MASS SPECTROMETER QUADRUPOLE THROUGH A DIFFERENTIALLY PUMPED VACUUM INTERFACE AND ION OPTICS; SEPARATED ON THE BASIS OF THEIR MASS-TO-CHARGE (m/z) RATIO; AND DETECTED BY AN ELECTRON CHANNEL MULTIPLIER (ECM). THE ALUMINUM IS MEASURED AT ISOTOPE MASS 27 AMU (ATOMIC MASS UNITS) AND COMPARED WITH STANDARD SOLUTIONS. REFERENCE: NATIONAL LABORATORY OF ENVIRONMENTAL TESTING,NWRI,            METHOD 02-2060,BURLINGTON,ONT.,1996.

AN UNFILTERED SAMPLE ALIQUOT AND MIXTURE OF AMMONIUM MOLYBDATE AND DILUTE SULPHRIC ARE PIPETTED BY THE ROBITS PIPETTOR INTO A PLASTIC CUVETTE ROTOR. THE ROTOR ACCELERATES AND MIXES THE SAMPLE AND THE REAGENTS BY CENTRIFUGAL FORCES. OXALIC AND ASCORBIC ACID REAGENTS ARE SUCCESSUVELY ADDED TO THE PREVIOUS MIXTURE, FIRST TO DESTROY ANY COMPLEX FORMED BY THE PHOSPHATE ION PRESENT IN THE SAMPLE, AND SECONDLY TO REDUCE MOLYBDOSILICIC ACID COMPLEX THUS FORMED. TO MOLYBDENUM BLUE COMPLEX. THE ABSORBANCE OF MOLYBDENUM BLUE COMPLEX IS MEASURED PHOTOMETRICAALY AT 660 NM. THE SILICA CONCENTRATION IS DETERMINED BY COMPARISON OF THE ABSORBANCE OUTPUT WITH THE CALIBRATION CURVE DRAWN FROM THE ABSORBANCE OUTPUTS OF SIMILARLY TREATED CALIBRATION STANDARD SOLUTIONS
ATOMIC ABSORPTION. ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY.1974. (METHODS FOR ANALYSIS OF WATER AND WASTES). USEPA. CINCINNATI,OHIO.

METALS, TOTAL, INDUCTIVELY COUPLED ARGON PLASMA - OPTICAL EMISSION SPECTROMETRY - (ICP-OES): A WATER SAMPLE IS COLLECTED UNFILTERED AND PRESERVED IN 0.2 PERCENT NITRIC ACID. A SAMPLE ALIQUOT IS DIGESTED AND EVAPORATED TO NEAR DRYNESS.THE RESIDUE IS REDIGESTED WITH HYDROCHLORIC ACID ALSO TO NEAR DRYNESS. THE RESIDUE IS THEN DISSOLVED IN DEIONIZED WATER AT A RATIO OF ONE-TENTH THE ORIGINAL ALIQUOT VOLUME.THE DIGESTED SAMPLE IS INTRODUCED TO THE SPECTROMETER PLASMA BY AN EXTERNAL NEBULIZER (USN). THE EMMISSION OF THE SILVER IS MEASURED AT 328.1 NM AND COMPARED WITH STANDARD SOLUTIONS.

THE IONS PRODUCED ARE TRANSPORTED TO THE MASS SPECTROMETER QUADRUPOLE THROUGH A DIFFERENTIALLY PUMPED VACUUM INTERFACE AND ION OPTICS; SEPARATED ON THE BASIS OF THEIR MASS-TO- CHARGE (m/z) RATIO; AND DETECTED BY AN ELECTRON CHANNEL MULTIPLIER (ECM). THE THALLIUM IS MEASURED AT ISOTOPE MASS 205 AMU (ATOMIC MASS UNITS) AND COMPARED WITH STANDARD SOLUTIONS. REFERENCE:NATIONAL LABORATORY OF ENVIRONMENTAL TESTING,NWRI,           METHOD 02-2060, BURLINGTON,ONT.,1996.

A DECANTED PORTION OF THE SAMPLE IS INTRODUCED DIRECTLY INTO A RADIOFREQUENCY ARGON PLASMA BY PNEUMATIC NEBULIZATION. METHOD 02-2060, BURLINGTON,ONT.,1996.

AN ALIQUOT OF FILTERED SAMPLE MIXED WITH CESIUM CHLORIDE SUPPRESSANT SOLUTION IS ASPIRATED INTO THE AIR-ACETYLENE FLAME OF AN ATOMIC ABSORPTION SPECTROMETER AND ATOMIZED. A LIGHT BEAM FROM A POTASSIUM HOLLOW CATHODE LAMP, WHICH PROVIDES ITS OWN CHARACTERISTIC ABSORPTION WAVELENGTH, IS DIRECTED THROUGH THE FLAME INTO A MONOCHROMATOR AND ONTO A DETECTOR THAT MEASURES THE AMOUNT OF LIGHT ABSORBED BY THE ATOMIZED ELEMENT IN THE FLAME. THE ABSORBANCE IS MEASURED AT 769.9 NM. THE AMOUNT OF ENERGY AT THE CHARACTERISTIC WAVELENGTH OF POTASSIUM ABSORBED IN THE FLAME IS PROPORTIONAL TO THE CONCENTRATION OF POTASSIUM IN THE SAMPLE.

AN ALIQUOT OF UNFILTERED SAMPLE MIXED WITH CESIUM CHLORIDE SUPPRESSANT SOLUTION IS ASPIRATED INTO THE AIR-ACETYLENE FLAME OF AN ATOMIC ABSORPTION SPECTROMETER AND ATOMIZED. A LIGHT BEAM FROM A POTASSIUM HOLLOW CATHODE LAMP, WHICH PROVIDES ITS OWN CHARACTERISTIC ABSORPTION WAVELENGTH, IS DIRECTED THROUGH THE FLAME INTO A MONOCHROMATOR AND ONTO A DETECTOR THAT MEASURES THE AMOUNT OF LIGHT ABSORBED BY THE ATOMIZED ELEMENT IN THE FLAME. A LIGHT BEAM FROM A SODIUM HOLLOW CATHODE LAMP, WHICH PROVIDES ITS OWN CHARACTERISTIC ABSORPTION WAVELENGTH, IS DIRECTED THROUGH THE FLAME INTO A MONOCHROMATOR AND ONTO A DETECTOR THAT MEASURES THE AMOUNT OF LIGHT ABSORBED BY THE ATOMIZED ELEMENT IN THE FLAME. AN ALIQUOT OF UNFILTERED SAMPLE MIXED WITH CESIUM CHLORDIE SUPPRESSANT SOLUTION IS ASPIRATED INTO THE AIR-ACETYLENE FLAME OF AN ATOMIC ABSORPTION SPECTROMETER AND ATOMIZED. NEUTRAL EXTRACTION USING LVX AND ELUTED THROUGH MODIFIED SILICA GEL. EXTRACT IS THEN CONCENTRATED AND ANALYSED ON THE GC/MS.
NEUTRAL EXTRACTION USING SONIFICATION AND ELUTED THROUGH MODIFIED SILICA GEL. EXTRACT IS THEN CONCENTRATED AND ANALYSED ON THE GC/MS.

A FILTERED SAMPLE ALIQUOT IS PUMPED INTO THE SPRAY CHAMBER WHERE THE NEBULIZER CARRIER GAS (ARGON) CONVERTS THE SAMPLE INTO A DENSE AEROSOL WHICH IS THEN INTRODUCED TO THE ARGON PLASMA. THE HIGH TEMPERATURE OF THE PLASMA DESOLVATES THE AEROSOL AND DISSOCIATES THE ELEMENTS PRESENT IN THE SAMPLE IN THEIR RESPECTIVE ATOMS. THESE ATOMS, WHEN EXCITED BY THE HIGH TEMPERATURE OF THE PLASMA,EMIT LIGHT AT WAVELENGTHS CHARACTERISTIC OF THE ELEMENT PRESENT. THE MAGNITUDE OF THE ELECTRONIC SIGNAL IS PROPORTIONAL TO THE LIGHT INTENSITY EMITTED BY THE ATOMS. THE ELECTRONIC SIGNAL IS INTEGRATED, AND THE SIGNAL IS MEASURED BY THE DETECTOR CIRCUIT.THE CALCIUM CONCENTRATION IS DETERMINED BY COMPARISON OF THE ELECTRONIC SIGNAL WITH THE CALIBRATION CURVE DRAWN FROM THE ELECTRONIC SIGNALS OF SIMILARLY TREATED CALIBRATION STANDARD SOLUTION.

THE POTASSIUM CONCENTRATION IS DETERMINED BY COMPARISON OF THE ELECTRONIC SIGNAL WITH THE CALIBRATION CURVE DRAWN FROM THE ELECTRONIC SIGNALS OF SIMILARLY TREATED CALIBRATION STANDARD SOLUTION.

A FILTERED SAMPLE ALIQUOT AND A MIXTURE OF AMMONIUM MOLYBDATE AND DILUTE SULPHURIC ACID ARE PIPETTED BY THE ROBOTICS PIPETTOR INTO A PLASTIC CUVETTE ROTOR. THE ROTOR ACCELERATES AND MIXES THE SAMPLE AND THE REAGENTS BY CENTRIFUGAL FORCES. OXALIC AND ASCORBIC ACID REAGENTS ARE SUCCESSIVELY ADDED TO THE PREVIOUS MIXTURE, FIRST TO DESTROY ANY COMPLEX FORMED BY THE PHOSPHATE ION PRESENT IN THE SAMPLE, AND SECONDLY TO REDUCE MOLYDOSILICIC ACID COMPLEX THUS FORMED TO MOLYDENUM BLUE COMPLEX. THE ABSORBANCE OF THIS COMPLEX MEASURED PHOTOMETRICALLY AT 660NM. THE SILICA CONCENTRATION IS DETERMINED BY COMPARISON OF THE ABSORBANCE OUTPUT OF THE SAMPLES WITH THE CALIBRATION CURVE DRAWN FROM THE ABSORBANCE OUTPUTS OF SIMILARLY TREATED CALIBRATION STANDARD SOLUTIONS.

A FILTERED SAMPLE ALIQUOT, START REAGENT AND BARIUM CHLORIDE REAGENT ARE SUCCESSIVELY PIPETTED BY THE ROBOTICS PIPETTOR INTO A PLASTIC PLASTIC CUVETTE ROTOR. THE ROTOR ACCELERATES AND MIXES THE SAMPLE AND THE REAGENTS BY CENTRIFUGAL FORCES. SULPHATE, IN ACID MEDIUM, REACTS WITH BARIUM CHLORIDE TO FORM A PRECIPITATE. THE ABSORBANCE OF THIS BARIUM SULPHATE SUSPENSION IS MEASURED PHOTOMETRICALLY AT 400NM. THE SULPHATE CONCENTRATION IS DETERMINED BY COMPARISON OF THE ABSORBANCE OUTPUT OF THE SAMPLES WITH THE CALIBRATION CURVE DRAWN FROM THE ABSORBANCE OUTPUTS OF SIMILARLY TREATED CALLIBRATION STANDARD SOLUTIONS.

A FILTERED SAMPLE ALIQUOT AND THE MIXED REAGENT OF MERCURIC THIOCYANATE AND FERRIC NITRATE ARE PIPETTED BY THE ROBOTICS PIPETTOR INTO A PLASTIC CUVETTE ROTOR. THE ROTOR ACCELERATES AND MIXES THE SAMPLE AND THE REAGENTS BY CENTRIFUGAL FORCES. THIOCYANATE ION IS LIBERATED FROM MERCURIC THIOCYANATE BY CHLORIDE AND SUBSEQUENTLY REACTS WITH FERRIC NITRATE TO FORM A FERRIC THIOCYANATE COMPLEX. THE ABSORBANCE OF THIS COMPLEX IS MEASURED PHOTOMETRICALLY AT 480NM. THE CHLORIDE CONCENTRATION IS DETERMINED BY COMPARISON OF THE ABSORBANCE OUTPUT OF THE SAMPLES WITH THE CALIBRATION CURVE DRAWN FROM THE OUTPUTS OF SIMILARLY TREATED CALIBRATION STANDARD SOLUTIONS.

FIFTY ML ALIQUOT WATER SAMPLES ARE PRESERVED WITH 2 ML SALINE FORMALDEHYDE(25ML ACHO PER LITRE 0.9_ NACL W/V IN THE LABORATORY THE SAMPLES ARE INOCULATED WITH 1ML TWEEN 80(5,000PPM) AND SHAKEN MECHANICALLY FOR 5 MINUTES. THEN SAMPLES ARE PREFILTERED THROUGH A 25  STAINLESS STEEL MESH FILTER AND THE FILTRATE CENTRIFUGED FOR 10 MIN. AT 1500 RPM. THE SUPERNATENT IS POURED INTO A 50 ML BEAKER,STIRRED MECHANICALLY AND PASSED THROUGH A MODEL B COULTER COUNTER EQUIPPED WITH 30 MICRON DIAMETER ORIFICE TUBE AND A J-PLOTTER. NATIONAL HEALTH + WELFARE 1969 METHOD DEVELOPED FOR GREAT LAKES WATERS BY PUBLIC HEALTH ENGINEERING DIVISION KINGSTON LABORATORIES. ENUMERATION AND  ISOLATION TECHNIQUES ARE REPORTED IN THE MANUAL METHODS FOR MICROBIOLOGICAL ANALYSIS OF  WATERS, WASTEWATERS AND SEDIMENTS. I.W.D., SCI. OPS. DIV., C.C.I.W., B.J.DUTKA

SAMPLE IS EXTRACTED WITH METHYLENE CHLORIDE AND CONCENTRATED TO 2ML. HALF IS RUN THROUGH SILICA GEL,COLLECTED AND ANALYSED FOR OCs AND PCB USING GC/ECD. THE REMAINING HALF IS ANALYSED FOR PAHs USING GC/MSD. THE METHOD IS OFFERED TO CLIENTS USING THE NIAGARA RIVER PROTOCOL FOR SAMPLES SPECIFIC TO THE REGION. PRACTICAL DETECTION LIMITS ARE REPORTED.

SAMPLE IS EXTRACTED WITH METHYLENE CHLORIDE AND CONCENTRATED TO 2ML. HALF IS RUN THROUGH SILICA GEL,COLLECTED AND ANALYSED FOR OCs AND PCB USING GC/ECD. THE REMAINING HALF IS ANALYSED FOR PAHs USING GC/MSD. (SURROGATES).

A DRIED,GROUND AND HOMOGENIZED SAMPLE IS WEIGHED IN A PORCELAIN CRUCIBLE,IGNITED AT 550 DEGREES C FOR 2 HOURS AND THE RESIDUE AFTER IGNITION IS DIGESTED FOR 16 HOURS AT ROOM TEMPERATURE (FROM 20-24 DEGREES C)WITH 1 N HYDROCHLORIC ACID. DETECTION OF PHOSPHATE IN THE DILUTE ACID EXTRACT IS BASED ON THE REACTION OF AMMONIUM MOLYBDATE WITH ORTHOPHOSPHATE TO FORM MOLYBDOPHOSPHORIC ACID, WHICH IS THEN REDUCED BY ASCORBIC ACID TO AN INTENSELY COLOURED HETEROPOLY MOLYBDOPHOSPHORIC ACID COMPLEX. THE COLOUR PRODUCED IS PROPORTIONAL TO THE ORTHOPHOSPHATE CONCENTRATION AND ITS QUANTITY IS MEASURED COLORIMETRICALLY AT 660 NM WAVELENGTH.

THE MEMBRANE FILTRATION PROCEDURE UTILIZES DRAKEIS MEMBRANE FILTRATION AGAR WITH A 3 DAY AEROBIC INCUBATION PERIOD AT 38DEG.C COLONIES WHICH FLUORESCE GREEN UNDER A LONG WAVE U.V.LAMP ARE COUNTED. ALL DOUBTFUL COLONIES ARE CONFIRMED BY TRANSFER TO ACETAMIDE AGAR AND O/F MEDIA. THE METHOD WAS OBTAINED FROM NOTES BY B.J.DUTKA AT CCIW BURLINGTON. ENUMERATION AND  ISOLATION TECHNIQUES ARE REPORTED IN THE MANUAL METHODS FOR MICROBIOLOGICAL ANALYSIS OF  WATERS, WASTEWATERS AND SEDIMENTS. I.W.D., SCI. OPS. DIV., C.C.I.W., B.J.DUTKA EXPONENTIAL FORM OF XXLNN (SEE CODE 700)

GF/C FILTERS ARE WEIGHED FOR SESTON WEIGHT, THEN ASHED AT 500C FOR 2 HOURS, AND REWEIGHED. SUBTRACT WEIGHT OF ASHES FROM DRY WEIGHT TO OBTAIN ASH FREE DRY WEIGHT.(DUPLICATES SHOULD BE AVERAGED BEFORE ENTERING)

UP TO 50L OF WATER ARE EXTRACTED USING THE GOULDEN LARGE VOLUME EXTRACTOR WITH DICHLOROMETHANE. THE EXTRACT IS DRIED WITH SODIUM SULPHATE AND CONCENTRATED TO A 2 ML FINAL VOLUME. ONE ML IS THEN FRACTIONATED BY COLUMN CHROMATOGRAPHY WITH 3% DEACTIVATED SILICA GEL. A FINAL VOLUME OF 1 ML IS USED FOR T-PCB AND OC-CB ANALYSIS. STARTING IN FY 1998, 3% DEACTIVATED SILICA GEL WAS REPLACED WITH FULLY ACTIVATED SILICA GEL. THE REMAINING 1 ML IS CONCENTRATED TO A 100 UL FINAL VOLUME AND ANALYSED FOR PAHS. T-PCB IS MEASURED USING SINGLE MEGABORE CAPILLARY COLUMN GAS CHROMATOGRAPHY WITH ELECTRON CAPTURE DETECTION. DUAL CAPILLARY COLUMN GAS CHROMATOGRAPHY WITH ELECTRON CAPTURE DETECTION IS USED TO DETERMINE CBS AND OCS. SINGLE CAPILLARY COLUMN GAS CHROMATOGRAPHY-MASS SPECTROMETRY WITH SELECTIVE ION MONITORING IS USED TO MEASURE PAHS.
SAME AS CODE 720
FROM AN INTEGRATED SAMPLE SAME AS CODE 720

LIGHT IS MEASURED AT ONE METRE INTERVALS IN THE WATER COLUMN. VEC = (LN I1 - LN I2) DIVIDED BY (Z2 - Z1) WHERE I IS THE LIGHT INTENSITY AT DEPTH Z1 AND  I2 IS THE  LIGHT INTENSITY AT Z2. NO PARTICULAR DEPTH NEED BE SPECIFIED. IF ONE IS NECESSARY, INTEGRATED (0-10M) WOULD BE THE MOST APPROPRIATE.
32PO4 IS ADDED TO THE WATER SAMPLE. UPTAKE IS MEASURED THROUGH TIME BY THE PERCENTAGE RADIOACTIVITY RETAINED BY FILTERS. UPTAKE RATE IS CONVERTED TO TURNOVER TIME.

FROM A FILTERED INTEGRATED SAMPLE. FILTER 0.5,1.0 OR 1.5L WATER THROUGH PREWEIGHED GF/C FILTER, FREEZE TO STORE. DRY 4 HOURS AT 60C AND WEIGH AGAIN. WEIGHT DIFFERENCE IS DRY WEIGHT OF SESTON. FILTERS MUST BE WASHED AND ASHED TO STABALIZE WEIGHT BEFORE PREWEIGH.(DUPLICATES SHOULD BE AVERAGED BEFORE ENTERING).

FROM AN INTEGRATED SAMPLE GF/C FILTERS ARE WEIGHED FOR SESTON WEIGHT,THEN ASHED AT 500C FOR 2 HOURS, + REWEIGHED. SUBTRACT WEIGHT OF ASHES FROM DRY WEIGHT TO OBTAIN ASH FREE DRY WEIGHT.(DUPLICATES SHOULD BE AVERAGED BEFORE ENTERING)

FILTER 0.5,1.0 OR 1.5L WATER THROUGH PREWEIGHED GF/C FILTER, FREEZE TO STORE. DRY 4 HOURS AT 60C AND WEIGH AGAIN. WEIGHT DIFFERENCE IS DRY WEIGHT OF SESTON. FILTERS MUST BE WASHED + ASHED TO STABALIZE WEIGHT BEFORE PREWEIGH.(DUPLICATES SHOULD BE AVERAGED BEFORE ENTERING)

AN UNFILTERED WATER SAMPLE IS COLLECTED IN A CLEAN METAL FREE TEFLON (FEP,PFA)OR HDPE PLASTIC BOTTLE AND PRESERVED IN 0.2% NITRIC ACID. A SUITABLE QUANTITY OF NITRIC ACID IS ADDED TO THE CONTAINER TO BRING THE FINAL CONCENTRATION TO 2% NITRIC ACID. THE FIRMLY CAPPED BOTTLE IS PLACED IN A SEALED CONTAINER. THE CONTAINER IS PLACED IN A LABORATORY CONVECTION OVEN AND THE SAMPLE IS ALLOWED TO DIGEST "IN- BOTTLE" FOR 16 HOURS AT 60 DEGREES C. THE WATER SAMPLE IS REMOVED FROM THE OVEN,COOLED TO ROOM TEMPERATURE AND ANALYZED BY ICP-MS.

THE CONTAINER IS PLACED IN A LABORATORY CONVECTION OVEN AND THE SAMPLE IS ALLOWED TO DIGEST "IN- BOTTLE" FOR 16 HOURS AT 60 DEGREES C. THE WATER SAMPLE IS REMOVED FROM THE OVEN,COOLED TO ROOM TEMPERATURE AND ANALYZED BY ICP-MS.

UP TO 50L OF WATER ARE EXTRACTED USING THE GOULDEN LARGE VOLUME EXTRACTOR WITH DICHLOROMETHANE. THE EXTRACT IS DRIED WITH SODIUM SULPHATE AND CONCENTRATED TO A 2 ML FINAL VOLUME. ONE ML IS THEN FRACTIONATED BY COLUMN CHROMATOGRAPHY WITH 3% DEACTIVATED SILICA GEL. A FINAL VOLUME OF 1 ML IS USED FOR T-PCB AND OC-CB ANALYSIS. STARTING IN FY 1998, 3% DEACTIVATED SILICA GEL WAS REPLACED WITH FULLY ACTIVATED SILICA GEL. THE REMAINING 1 ML IS CONCENTRATED TO A 100 UL FINAL VOLUME AND ANALYSED FOR PAHS. T-PCB IS MEASURED USING SINGLE MEGABORE CAPILLARY COLUMN GAS CHROMATOGRAPHY WITH ELECTRON CAPTURE DETECTION. DUAL CAPILLARY COLUMN GAS CHROMATOGRAPHY WITH ELECTRON CAPTURE DETECTION IS USED TO DETERMINE CBS AND OCS. SINGLE CAPILLARY COLUMN GAS CHROMATOGRAPHY-MASS SPECTROMETRY WITH SELECTIVE ION MONITORING IS USED TO MEASURE PAHS.

ONE ML IS THEN FRACTIONATED BY COLUMN CHROMATOGRAPHY WITH 3% DEACTIVATED SILICA GEL. A FINAL VOLUME OF 1 ML IS USED FOR T-PCB AND OC-CB ANALYSIS. DUAL CAPILLARY COLUMN GAS CHROMATOGRAPHY WITH ELECTRON CAPTURE DETECTION IS USED TO DETERMINE CBS AND OCS. SINGLE CAPILLARY COLUMN GAS CHROMATOGRAPHY-MASS SPECTROMETRY WITH SELECTIVE ION MONITORING IS USED TO MEASURE PAHS.

20L OF SAMPLE WATER IS ACIDIFIED TO A PH OF <2.0 AND EXTRACTED WITH DCM USING THE LARGE VOLUME EXTRACTOR. THE EXTRACT IS PASSED THROUGH SODIUM SULPHATE AND EVAPORATED TO DRYNESS. THE EXTRACT IS THEM DERIVATIZED WITH PFBBr AND ELUTED THROUGH MODIFIED SILICA. SAMPLE IS CONCENTRATED TO 10.0 ML AND ANALYZED BY GC/MS.

METALS FROM A HOMOGENIZED SEDIMENT SAMPLE ARE EXTRACTED IN A MIXTURE OF NITRIC ACID, HYDROCHLORIC ACID AND HYDROGEN PEROXIDE. THE PROCEDURE USES CLOSED VESSEL, HIGH PRESSURE MICROWAVE ASSISTED DIGESTION AND THE RESULTING SOLUTION IS DILUTED AND ANALYZED BY INDUCIVELY COUPLED PLASMA-MASS SPECTROMETRY (ICP-MS).

METALS IN WATER, TOTAL, "IN-BOTTLE" DIGESTION, ICP-SFMS: THE WHOLE WATER SAMPLE COLLECTED IN A HDPE/TEFLON BOTTLE, IS DE-CAPPED IN A CLASS 100 WORKSTATION, ACIDIFIED TO 2% (V/V) HNO3 AND 1% (V/V) HCI AND RECAPPED. THE SAMPLE IS "IN BOTTLE" DIGESTED IN A CONVECTION OVEN SET AT 60 DEGREES C FOR 16 HOURS. THE SAMPLE IS COOLED AND INTRODUCED TO AN INDUCTIVELY COUPLED ARGON PLASMA-SECTOR FIELD MASS SPECTROMETER (ICP-SFMS) BY PNEUMATIC NEBULIZATION. EACH RESPECTIVE ELEMENT IS MEASURED AT A SPECIFIC MASS TO CHARGE RATIO, M/Z VALUE EXPRESSED IN AMU (ATOMIC MASS UNITS) , AND AT A SPECIFIED INSTRUMENT RESOLUTION. SILVER IS ANALYZED AT LOW RESOLUTION ~ 300, ISOTOPIC MASS 107 AMU; REF: NLET METHOD NUMBER 02-2003

NON- INTEGRATED

THE WHOLE WATER SAMPLE IS FILTERED THROUGH A 0.45 MICRON CELLULOSE ACETATE FILTER PAPER AND THE FILTRATE STORED IN A POLYETHYLENE BOTTLE. THE TOTAL ALKALINITY IS DETERMINED BY POTENTIOMETRIC TITRATION WITH A 0.02 N SULPHURIC ACID SOLUTION. THE PROCEDURE AND DERIVATION OF THE INFLECTION POINT IS FULLY AUTOMATED UTILIZING THE PC-TITRATE SYSTEM (MANUFACTURER MANDEL SCIENTIFIC). SHOULD THE INFLECTION POINT NOT BE DETECTED, A FIXED ENDPOINT AT PH 4.5 IS CALCULATED. INTEGRATED DEPTH.

THE WHOLE WATER SAMPLE IS FILTERED THROUGH A 0.45 MICRON CELLULOSE ACETATE FILTER PAPER AND THE FILTRATE STORED IN A POLYETHYLENE BOTTLE. THE GRAN ALKALINITY IS ONLY APPLICABLE TO SAMPLES HAVING A PH LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO 7.0. THIS IS DETERMINED BY POTENTIOMETRIC TITRATION OF THE SAMPLE WITH A 0.002N SULPHURIC ACID SOLUTION. THE PROCEDURE AND DETERMINATION OF THE INFLECTION POINT BY THE GRAN CALCULATION IS FULLY AUTOMATED UTILIZING THE PC-TITRATE SYSTEM (MANUFACTURER MANDEL SCIENTIFIC). INTEGRATED DEPTH.

ALKALINITY, GRAN, TOTAL, UNFILTERED: TITROPROCESSOR, A 50 ML. SAMPLE IS TITRATED WITH 0.005N H2S04. THE INFLECTION POINT IS DERIVED USING THE GRAN CALCULATION.

SULPHATE BY ION CHROMOTOGRAPHY, FILTERED: THE WHOLE WATER SAMPLE IS FILTERED THROUGH A 0.45 MICRON CELLULOSE ACETATE FILTER PAPER AND THE FILTRATE IS STORED IN A POLYETHYLENE BOTTLE. THE FILTRATE IS INJECTED INTO THE ELUENT STREAM OF AN ION CHROMATOGRAPH. THE STREAM IS PUMPED THROUGH TWO COLUMNS (SEPARATOR AND SUPPRESSOR) PACKED WITH LOW CAPACITY ANION EXCHANGE RESIN IN THE FORM OF CO3/HCO3. THE IONS OF INTEREST ARE SEPARATED BASED ON THEIR AFFINITY FOR THE EXCHANGE SITES OF THE RESIN BED. THE SUPPRESSOR COLUMN REDUCES THE BACKGROUND CONDUCTIVITY OF THE ELUENT TO A NEGLIGIBLE LEVEL BY CONVERTING THE ANIONS IN THE SAMPLE TO THEIR RESPECTIVE ACID FORMS. THE CONCENTRATION OF THESE SEPARATED ANIONS ARE DETERMINED BY MEASURING THEIR RESPECTIVE CONDUCTIVITY USING A CONDUCTIVITY DETECTOR. THE SULPHATE ION IS IDENTIFIED BY ITS RETENTION TIME COMPARED TO A KNOWN STANDARD. REF: NLET METHOD NUMBER 01-1080

CHLORIDE BY ION CHROMOTOGRAPHY, FILTERED: THE WHOLE WATER SAMPLE IS FILTERED THROUGH A 0.45 MICRON CELLULOSE ACETATE FILTER PAPER AND THE FILTRATE IS STORED IN A POLYETHYLENE BOTTLE. THE FILTRATE IS INJECTED INTO THE ELUENT STREAM OF AN ION CHROMATOGRAPH. THE STREAM IS PUMPED THROUGH TWO COLUMNS (SEPARATOR AND SUPPRESSOR) PACKED WITH LOW CAPACITY ANION EXCHANGE RESIN IN THE FORM OF CO3/HCO3. THE IONS OF INTEREST ARE SEPARATED BASED ON THEIR AFFINITY FOR THE EXCHANGE SITES OF THE RESIN BED. THE SUPPRESSOR COLUMN REDUCES THE BACKGROUND CONDUCTIVITY OF THE ELUENT TO A NEGLIGIBLE LEVEL BY CONVERTING THE ANIONS IN THE SAMPLE TO THEIR RESPECTIVE ACID FORMS. THE CONCENTRATION OF THESE SEPARATED ANIONS ARE DETERMINED BY MEASURING THEIR RESPECTIVE CONDUCTIVITY USING A CONDUCTIVITY DETECTOR. THE CHLORIDE ION IS IDENTIFIED BY ITS RETENTION TIME COMPARED TO A KNOWN STANDARD. REF: NLET METHOD NUMBER 01-1080

THE GRAN ALKALINITY IS ONLY APPLICABLE TO SAMPLES HAVING A PH LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO 7.0. THIS IS DETERMINED BY POTENTIOMETRIC TITRATION OF THE WHOLE WATER SAMPLE WITH A 0.002N SULPHURIC ACID SOLUTION THE PROCEDURE AND DETERMINATION OF THE INFLECTION POINT BY THE GRAN CALCULATION IS FULLY AUTOMATED UTILIZING THE PC-TITRATE SYSTEM. (MANUFACTURER MANDEL SCIENTIFIC). INTEGRATED DEPTH

THE GRAN ALKALINITY IS ONLY APPLICABLE TO SAMPLES HAVING A PH LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO 7.0. THIS IS DETERMINED BY POTENTIOMETRIC TITRATION OF THE WHOLE WATER SAMPLE WITH A 0.002N SULPHURIC ACID SOLUTION. THE PROCEDURE AND DETERMINATION OF THE INFLECTION POINT BY THE GRAN CALCULATION IS FULLY AUTOMATED UTILIZING THE PC-TITRATE SYSTEM. (MANUFACTURER MANDEL SCIENTIFIC).

CHLORIDE BY ION CHROMOTOGRAPHY, FILTERED: THE WHOLE WATER SAMPLE IS FILTERED THROUGH A 0.45 MICRON CELLULOSE ACETATE FILTER PAPER AND THE FILTRATE IS STORED IN A POLYETHYLENE BOTTLE. THE FILTRATE IS INJECTED INTO THE ELUENT STREAM OF AN ION CHROMATOGRAPH. THE STREAM IS PUMPED THROUGH TWO COLUMNS (SEPARATOR AND SUPPRESSOR) PACKED WITH LOW CAPACITY ANION EXCHANGE RESIN IN THE FORM OF CO3/HCO3. THE IONS OF INTEREST ARE SEPARATED BASED ON THEIR AFFINITY FOR THE EXCHANGE SITES OF THE RESIN BED. THE SUPPRESSOR COLUMN REDUCES THE BACKGROUND CONDUCTIVITY OF THE ELUENT TO A NEGLIGIBLE LEVEL BY CONVERTING THE ANIONS IN THE SAMPLE TO THEIR RESPECTIVE ACID FORMS. THE CONCENTRATION OF THESE SEPARATED ANIONS ARE DETERMINED BY MEASURING THEIR RESPECTIVE CONDUCTIVITY USING A CONDUCTIVITY DETECTOR. THE CHLORIDE ION IS IDENTIFIED BY ITS RETENTION TIME COMPARED TO A KNOWN STANDARD. REF: NLET METHOD NUMBER 01-1080. THIS METHOD IS USED FOR INTEGRATED SAMPLES

SULPHATE BY ION CHROMOTOGRAPHY, FILTERED: THE WHOLE WATER SAMPLE IS FILTERED THROUGH A 0.45 MICRON CELLULOSE ACETATE FILTER PAPER AND THE FILTRATE IS STORED IN A POLYETHYLENE BOTTLE. THE FILTRATE IS INJECTED INTO THE ELUENT STREAM OF AN ION CHROMATOGRAPH. THE SUPPRESSOR COLUMN REDUCES THE BACKGROUND CONDUCTIVITY OF THE ELUENT TO A NEGLIGIBLE LEVEL BY CONVERTING THE ANIONS IN THE SAMPLE TO THEIR RESPECTIVE ACID FORMS. THE CONCENTRATION OF THESE SEPARATED ANIONS ARE DETERMINED BY MEASURING THEIR RESPECTIVE CONDUCTIVITY USING A CONDUCTIVITY DETECTOR. THE SULPHATE ION IS IDENTIFIED BY ITS RETENTION TIME COMPARED TO A KNOWN STANDARD. REF: NLET METHOD NUMBER 01-1080. THIS METHOD IS USED FOR INTEGRATED SAMPLES

A SEDIMENT SAMPLE IS COLLECTED, FREEZE DRIED AND HOMOGENIZED. TO MEASURE ORGANIC CARBON A PORTION OF THE SAMPLE IS TREATED WITH 6% SULPHUROUS ACID TO EXPEL INORGANIC FORMS OF CARBON. THE TREATED PORTION IS THEN AIR DRIED AT ROOM TEMPERATURE AND ANALYZED BY A ELEMENTAL CHN ANALYZER. THE ANALYTICAL PRINCIPLES INCLUDE THERMAL COMBUSTION, CATALYTIC OXIDATION TO CO2, CHROMATOGRAPHIC SEPARATION AND THERMAL CONDUCTIVITY DETECTION. THIS METHOD IS USED FOR INTEGRATED SAMPLES.

A SEDIMENT SAMPLE IS COLLECTED, FREEZE DRIED AND HOMOGENIZED. TO MEASURE ORGANIC CARBON A PORTION OF THE SAMPLE IS TREATED WITH 6% SULPHUROUS ACID TO EXPEL INORGANIC FORMS OF CARBON. THE TREATED PORTION IS THEN AIR DRIED AT ROOM TEMPERATURE AND ANALYZED BY A ELEMENTAL CHN ANALYZER. THE ANALYTICAL PRINCIPLES INCLUDE THERMAL COMBUSTION, CATALYTIC OXIDATION TO CO2, CHROMATOGRAPHIC SEPARATION AND THERMAL CONDUCTIVITY DETECTION.

A SEDIMENT SAMPLE IS COLLECTED, FREEZE DRIED AND HOMOGENIZED. TO MEASURE INORGANIC CARBON, TWO SEPARATE ALIQUOTS FROM THE SAME SAMPLE ARE TAKEN. THE FIRST ALIQUOT IS ANALYZED FOR TOTAL CARBON BY AN ELEMENTAL CHN ANALYZER. THE ANALYTICAL PRINCIPLES INCLUDE THERMAL COMBUSTION, CATALYTIC OXIDATION TO CO2, CHROMATOGRAPHIC SEPARATION AND THERMAL CONDUCTIVITY DETECTION. THE SECOND ALIQUOT IS TREATED WITH 6% SULPHUROUS ACID TO EXPEL INORGANIC FORMS OF CARBON. THE TREATED PORTION IS THEN AIR DRIED AT ROOM TEMPERATURE AND ANALYZED AS ORGANIC CARBON BY THE CHN ANALYZER. INORGANIC CARBON IS MEASURED BY CALCULATION OF THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN UNTREATED AND TREATED PORTIONS. (INORGANIC CARBON = TOTAL CARBON - ORGANIC CARBON). THIS METHOD IS USED FOR INTEGRATED SAMPLES.

A SEDIMENT SAMPLE IS COLLECTED, FREEZE DRIED AND HOMOGENIZED. TO MEASURE INORGANIC CARBON, TWO SEPARATE ALIQUOTS FROM THE SAME SAMPLE ARE TAKEN. THE FIRST ALIQUOT IS ANALYZED FOR TOTAL CARBON BY AN ELEMENTAL CHN ANALYZER. THE ANALYTICAL PRINCIPLES INCLUDE THERMAL COMBUSTION, CATALYTIC OXIDATION TO CO2, CHROMATOGRAPHIC SEPARATION AND THERMAL CONDUCTIVITY DETECTION. THE SECOND ALIQUOT IS TREATED WITH 6% SULPHUROUS ACID TO EXPEL INORGANIC FORMS OF CARBON. THE TREATED PORTION IS THEN AIR DRIED AT ROOM TEMPERATURE AND ANALYZED AS ORGANIC CARBON BY THE CHN ANALYZER. INORGANIC CARBON IS MEASURED BY CALCULATION OF THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN UNTREATED AND TREATED PORTIONS. (INORGANIC CARBON = TOTAL CARBON - ORGANIC CARBON).

A SEDIMENT SAMPLE IS COLLECTED, FREEZE DRIED AND HOMOGENIZED. ORGANIC NITROGEN IS MEASURED IN CONJUNCTION WITH ORGANIC CARBON AND A PORTION OF THE SAMPLE IS TREATED WITH 6% SULPHUROUS ACID. THE TREATED PORTION IS THEN AIR DRIED AT ROOM TEMPERATURE AND ANALYZED BY AN ELEMENTAL CHN ANALYZER. THE ANALYTICAL PRINCIPLES INCLUDE THERMAL COMBUSTION, CONVERSION TO N2, CHROMATOGRAPHIC SEPARATION AND THERMAL CONDUCTIVITY DETECTION. THIS METHOD IS USED FOR INTEGRATED SAMPLES.

METALS FROM A HOMOGENIZED SEDIMENT ARE EXTRACTED IN A MIXTURE OF NITRIC ACID, HYDROCHLORIC ACID AND HYDROGEN PEROXIDE. THE PROCEDURE USES CLOSED VESSEL, HIGH PRESSURE MICROWAVE ASSISTED DIGESTION. THE COOLED EXTRACT UNDERGOES A SECOND OPEN VESSEL DIGESTION WITH HYDROFLUORIC ACID, OVERNIGHT. THE RESULTING SOLUTION IS DILUTED AND ANALYZED BY INDUCTIVELY COUPLED PLASMA-MASS SPECTROMETRY (ICP-MS).

METALS FROM A HOMOGENIZED BIOLOGICAL TISSUE ARE EXTRACTED IN A MIXTURE OF NITRIC ACID AND HYDROGEN PEROXIDE. THE PROCEDURE USES CLOSED VESSEL, HIGH PRESSURE MICROWAVE ASSISTED DIGESTION. THE RESULTING SOLUTION IS DILUTED AND ANALYZED BY INDUCTIVELY COUPLED PLASMA-MASS SPECTROMETRY (ICP-MS).

TURBIDITY, NEPHELOMETRIC METHOD: THE MEASUREMENT OF TURBIDITY IS BASED UPON A COMPARISON OF THE INTENSITY OF LIGHT SCATTERED BY A SHAKEN WHOLE WATER SAMPLE, UNDER DEFINED CONDITIONS, WITH THE INTENSITY OF LIGHT SCATTERED BY A STANDARD REFERENCE SUSPENSION, SUCH AS FORMAZIN. A LIGHT BEAM IS PASSED THROUGH A TRANSPARENT TUBE CONTAINING THE SAMPLE. THE SUSPENDED PARTICLES REFLECT THE LIGHT BEAM. LIGHT REFLECTED AT 90 DEGREES TO THE AXIS IS MEASURED BY A PHOTOELECTRIC DETECTOR AT 860 NM. FORMAZIN OR OTHER SUITABLE STANDARDS ARE USED IN THE CALIBRATION OF THE NEPHELOMETER. (SCIENTIFIC INC, MICRO 100 TURBIDIMETER). UNITS: NEPHELOMETER TURBIDITY UNITS (NTU) REF: NLET METHOD NUMBER 01-1900

(SCIENTIFIC INC, MICRO 100 TURBIDIMETER). UNITS: NEPHELOMETER TURBIDITY UNITS (NTU) REF: NLET METHOD NUMBER 01-1900
A SAMPLE ALIQUOT IS COMBINED WITH AN IONIZATION SUPPRESSANT AND RELEASING AGENT SOLUTION AND THE RESULTING SOLUTION IS ANALYZED BY AN ATOMIC ABSORPTION SPECTROPHOTOMETER.
A SAMPLE ALIQUOT IS COMBINED WITH AN IONIZATION SUPPRESSANT AND RELEASING AGENT SOLUTION AND THE RESULTING SOLUTION IS ANALYZED BY AN ATOMIC ABSORPTION SPECTROPHOTOMETER.
HARDNESS IS CALCULATED BY MULTIPLYING THE CONCENTRATION OF EACH CATION BY THE APPROPRIATE CONVERSION FACTOR AND SUMMING THEM TO OBTAIN THE CONCENTRATION OF TOTAL HARDNESS IN MG. CACO3/L.
A SAMPLE ALIQUOT IS COMBINED WITH AN IONIZATION SUPPRESSANT AND RELEASING AGENT SOLUTION AND THE RESULTING SOLUTION IS ANALYZED BY AN ATOMIC ABSORPTION SPECTROPHOTOMETER.
A SAMPLE ALIQUOT IS COMBINED WITH AN IONIZATION SUPPRESSANT AND RELEASING AGENT SOLUTION AND THE RESULTING SOLUTION IS ANALYZED BY AN ATOMIC ABSORPTION SPECTROPHOTOMETER.

A SAMPLE ALIQUOT IS COMBINED WITH AN IONIZATION SUPPRESSANT AND RELEASING AGENT SOLUTION AND ASPIRATED INTO THE AIR-ACETYLENE FLAME OF AN ATOMIC ABSORPTION SPECTROPHOTOMETER WHERE IT IS ATOMIZED. LIGHT FROM A HOLLOW CATHODE LAMP COMPOSED OF THE ANALYTICAL ELEMENT WHICH EMITS ITS OWN CHARACTERISTIC WAVELENGTHS IS DIRECTED THROUGH THE FLAME. A MONOCHROMETER SELECTS A SPECIFIC WAVELENGTH AND THIS LIGHT IS ABSORBED BY THE GROUND STATE ATOMS IN THE FLAME. THE AMOUNT OF LIGHT ENERGY ABSORBED IN THE FLAME IS PROPORTIONAL TO THE CONCENTRATION OF THE ELEMENT IN THE SAMPLES. THE SIGNAL PRODUCED AT THE DETECTOR IS THEN COMPARED TO THAT OF A SET OF STANDARDS SOLUTIONS OF KNOWN CONCENTRATIONS. A STANDARD CALIBRATION CURVE OF CONCENTRATION VS. ABSORBANCE IS MATHEMATICALLY PRODUCED AND THE AMOUNT OF EACH ELEMENT IN THE SAMPLES IS THEN CALCULATED.

THIS METHOD APPLIES TO A QUALITATIVE AND QUANTITATIVE DETERMINATION OF CHLOROBENZENES (CBs), ORGANOCHLORINE PESTICIDES (OCs), NEUTRAL HERBICIDES (NHs), POLYCYCLIC AROMATIC HYDROCARBONS (PAHs) AND CONGENER SPECIFIC POLYCHLORINATED BIPHENYLS (cPCBs) FROM 16-24 L OF FILTERED/CENTRIFUGED WATER USING LIQUID/LIQUID EXTRACTION [GOULDEN LARGE SAMPLE EXTRACTOR (GLSE)], SILICA GEL CLEANUP AND ANALYSIS BY GAS CHROMATOGRAPHY WITH MICRO()-ELECTRON CAPTURE (GC-ECD) AND MASS SELECTIVE DETECTORS (GC-MSD).

NEPHELOMETRIC METHOD, TURBIDITY METER (NEPHELOMETER): TURBIDITY IN WATER IS CAUSED BY SUSPENDED OR COLLOIDAL MATTER AND CONSEQUENTLY, LIGHT PASSING THROUGH MATTER IS SCATTERED. THIS CHARACTERISTIC OF WATER THAT CAUSES LIGHT SCATTERING IS REFERRED TO AS TURBIDITY. IN THE NEPHELOMETRIC METHOD LIGHT SCATTERED AT 90 DEGREES TO THE INCIDENT LIGHT IS MEASURED. THE WHOLE WATER SAMPLE IS SHAKEN AND POURED INTO TRANSPARENT CELL OR TUBE, WHICH ARE ALLOWED TO SIT FOR SUFFICIENT TIME TO ALLOW ANY AIR BUBBLES FORMED TO ESCAPE BEFORE BEING PLACED IN THE NEPHELOMETER. A STRONG LIGHT BEAM IS SENT THROUGH THE SAMPLE AND THE SUSPENDED PARTICLES REFLECT THE LIGHT. THE LIGHT WHICH IS REFLECTED AT 90 DEGREES TO THE AXIS IS RECEIVED BY PHOTO CELLS AND THEIR ELECTRICAL RESPONSE IS PROPORTIONAL TO THE AMOUNT RECEIVED AND HENCE TO THE SAMPLE TURBIDITY. CALIBRATION OF THE INSTRUMENT IS MADE USING A STANDARD OF FORMAZIN-THE REACTION PRODUCT OF AQUEOUS SOLUTION OF HYDRAZINE SULPHATE AND HEXAMETHYLENETETRAMINE. THE VALUE IS REPORTED IN UNITS OF NTU (NEPHELOMETRIC TURBIDITY UNITS).

NEPHELOMETRIC METHOD, TURBIDITY METER (NEPHELOMETER): TURBIDITY IN WATER IS CAUSED BY SUSPENDED OR COLLOIDAL MATTER AND CONSEQUENTLY, LIGHT PASSING THROUGH MATTER IS SCATTERED. THIS CHARACTERISTIC OF WATER THAT CAUSES LIGHT SCATTERING IS REFERRED TO AS TURBIDITY. IN THE NEPHELOMETRIC METHOD LIGHT SCATTERED AT 90 DEGREES TO THE INCIDENT LIGHT IS MEASURED. THE ALKALINITY MEASUREMENT IS MADE ON AN UNFILTERED, WHOLE WATER SAMPLE. THE TOTAL ALKALINITY IS DETERMINED BY POTENTIOMETRIC TITRATION WITH A 0.02 N SUPHURIC ACID SOLUTION. THE PROCEDURE AND DERIVATION OF THE INFLECTION POINT IS FULLY AUTOMATED UTILIZING THE PC-TITRATE SYSTEM (MANUFACTURER MANDEL SCIENTIFIC). SHOULD THE INFLECTION POINT NOT BE DETECTED, A FIXED ENDPOINT AT PH 4.5 IS CALCULATED.

THE ALKALINITY MEASUREMENT IS MADE ON AN UNFILTERED, WHOLE WATER SAMPLE. THE GRAN ALKALINITY IS ONLY APPLICABLE TO SAMPLES HAVING A PH LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO 7.0. THIS IS DETERMINED BY POTENTIOMETRIC TITRATION OF THE SAMPLE WITH A 0.002N SULPHURIC ACID SOLUTION. THE PROCEDURE AND DETERMINATION OF THE INFLECTION POINT BY THE GRAN CALCULATION IS FULLY AUTOMATED UTILIZING THE PC-TITRATE SYSTEM (MANUFACTURER MANDEL SCIENTIFIC).

THE ALKALINITY MEASUREMENT IS MADE ON AN UNFILTERED, WHOLE WATER SAMPLE. THE PHENOLPHTHALEIN ALKALINITY IS ONLY APPLICABLE TO SAMPLES HAVING A PH GREATER THAN  8.3. IT IS DETERMINED BY POTENTIOMETRIC TITRATION OF THE SAMPLE WITH A 0.02N SULPHURIC ACID SOLUTION TO THE FIXED ENDPOINT OF PH 8.3. THE PROCEDURE IS FULLY AUTOMATED UTILIZING THE PC-TITRATE SYSTEM (MANUFACTURER MANDEL SCIENTIFIC).

THE DISSOLVED CONTENT REFERS TO A WATER SAMPLE WHICH HAS BEEN FILTERED THROUGH A 0.45 MICROMETER MEMBRANE FILTER. THE FILTRATE IS STORED IN A CLEAN METAL FREE TEFLON (FEP, PFA) OR HDPE PLASTIC BOTTLE AND PRESERVED IN 0.2% NITRIC ACID. THE DISSOLVE CONTENT CAN BE ANALYSED BY EITHER DIRECT ASPIRATION OR IN-BOTTLE DIGESTION.

THE DISSOLVE CONTENT CAN BE ANALYSED BY EITHER DIRECT ASPIRATION OR IN-BOTTLE DIGESTION.

A WHOLE WATER SAMPLE IS DECANTED AND ANALYZED IN A CONTINUOUS SEGMENTED FLOW ANALYZER WHERE THE DISSOLVED SILICA PRESENT IN THE SAMPLE IS REACTED IN AN ACID MEDIUM WITH AMMONIUM MOLYBDATE TO FORM MOLYBDOSILICIC ACID. THE YELLOW COLOURED MOLYBDOSILICIC ACID IS THEN REDUCED WITH ASCORBIC ACID TO FORM A HETEROPOLY BLUE COMPLEX. THE CONCENTRATION OF SOLUBLE REACTIVE SILICA IS THEN MEASURED BY CFA PHOTOMETER AT 660 NM WAVELENGTH. THIS METHOD IS USED FOR INTEGRATED SAMPLES.

A FILTERED WATER SAMPLE IS DECANTED AND ANALYZED IN A CONTINUOUS SEGMENTED FLOW ANALYZER WHERE THE DISSOLVED NITRITE PRESENT IN THE SAMPLE IS REACTED IN AN ACID MEDIUM WITH SULPHANILAMIDE AND N-1 (-NAPTHYL_-ETHYLENEDIAMINE DIHYDOCHLORIDE) TO FORM A REDDISH-PURPLE AZO DYE. THE CONCENTRATION OF SOLUBLE NITRITE IS THEN MEASURED BY CFA PHOTOMETER AT 520 NM WAVELENGTH.

A FILTERED WATER SAMPLE IS DECANTED AND ANALYZED IN A CONTINUOUS SEGMENTED FLOW ANALYZER WHERE THE DISSOLVED NITRITE PRESENT IN THE SAMPLE IS REACTED IN AN ACID MEDIUM WITH SULPHANILAMIDE AND N-1 (-NAPTHYL_-ETHYLENEDIAMINE DIHYDOCHLORIDE) TO FORM A REDDISH-PURPLE AZO DYE. THE CONCENTRATION OF SOLUBLE NITRITE IS THEN MEASURED BY CFA PHOTOMETER AT 520 NM WAVELENGTH.

FLUORIDE BY ION CHROMOTOGRAPHY, FILTERED: AN ALIQUOT OF A FILTERED WATER SAMPLE IS INJECTED INTO THE ELUENT STREAM OF AN ION CHROMATOGRAPH. THE STREAM IS PUMPED THROUGH TWO COLUMNS (SEPARATOR AND SUPPRESSOR) PACKED WITH LOW CAPACITY ANION EXCHANGE RESIN IN THE FORM OF CO3/HCO3. THE IONS OF INTEREST ARE SEPARATED BASED ON THEIR AFFINITY FOR THE EXCHANGE SITES OF THE RESIN BED. THE SUPPRESSOR COLUMN REDUCES THE BACKGROUND CONDUCTIVITY OF THE ELEUENT TO A NEGLIGIBLE LEVEL BY CONVERTING THE ANIONS IN THE SAMPLE TO THEIR RESPECTIVE ACID FORMS. THE CONCENTRATION OF THESE SEPARATED ANIONS ARE DETERMINED BY MEASURING THEIR RESPECTIVE CONDUCTIVITY USING A CONDUCTIVITY DETECTOR. THE CHLORIDE ION IS IDENTIFIED BY ITS RETENTION TIME COMPARED TO A KNOWN STANDARD. REF: NLET METHOD NUMBER 01-1080. THIS METHOD IS USED FOR INTEGRATED AND NON-INTEGRATED SAMPLES.

FLUORIDE BY ION CHROMOTOGRAPHY, FILTERED: AN ALIQUOT OF A FILTERED WATER SAMPLE IS INJECTED INTO THE ELUENT STREAM OF AN ION CHROMATOGRAPH. THE STREAM IS PUMPED THROUGH TWO COLUMNS (SEPARATOR AND SUPPRESSOR) PACKED WITH LOW CAPACITY ANION EXCHANGE RESIN IN THE FORM OF CO3/HCO3. THE IONS OF INTEREST ARE SEPARATED BASED ON THEIR AFFINITY FOR THE EXCHANGE SITES OF THE RESIN BED. THE SUPPRESSOR COLUMN REDUCES THE BACKGROUND CONDUCTIVITY OF THE ELEUENT TO A NEGLIGIBLE LEVEL BY CONVERTING THE ANIONS IN THE SAMPLE TO THEIR RESPECTIVE ACID FORMS. THE CONCENTRATION OF THESE SEPARATED ANIONS ARE DETERMINED BY MEASURING THEIR RESPECTIVE CONDUCTIVITY USING A CONDUCTIVITY DETECTOR. THE CHLORIDE ION IS IDENTIFIED BY ITS RETENTION TIME COMPARED TO A KNOWN STANDARD. REF: NLET METHOD NUMBER 01-1080. THIS METHOD IS USED FOR INTEGRATED AND NON-INTEGRATED SAMPLES.

METALS IN WATER, TOTAL, "IN BOTTLE" DIGESTION, ICP-MS: THE WHOLE WATER SAMPLE COLLECTED IN A HDPE OR TEFLON BOTTLE, IS DE-CAPPED IN A CLASS 100 WORKSTATION, ACIDIFIED TO 2% (V/V) HNO3 AND RECAPPED. THE SAMPLE IS "IN-BOTTLE" DIGESTED IN A CONVECTION OVEN, SET AT 65 DEGREES C FOR 16 HOURS (OVERNIGHT). THE SAMPLE IS COOLED AND INTRODUCED TO AN INDUCTIVELY COUPLED ARGON PLASMA-COLLISION/REACTION CELL MASS SPECTROMETER (CRC-ICP-MS) BY DISCRETE SAMPLING PNEUMATIC NEBULIZATION. EACH RESPECTIVE ELEMENT IS MEASURED AT A SPECIFIC MASS TO CHARGE RATIO, M/Z VALUE EXPRESSED IN AMU (ATOMIC MASS UNITS). PARAMETERS ANALYZED IN REACTION GAS [H2] MODE, [SE(77)] ONLY, IN COLLISION GAS [HE] MODE INCLUDE [AL(27), AS(75), B(11), CO(59), CR(52), CU(65), FE(56), MN(55), NI(60), SR(86), TI(47), V(51), AND ZN(66)] AND IN NORMAL MODE INCLUDE [AG(107), BA(135), BE(9), BI(209), CD(111), CE(140), CS(133), GA(71), LA(139), LI(7), MO(98), NB(93), PB(208), PD(106), PT(195), RB(85), SB(121), SN(120), TL(205), U(238), W(184), Y(89)]. NLET, BURLINGTON, METHOD 02-2004. REQUESTED DECEMBER 2009.

PARAMETERS ANALYZED IN REACTION GAS [H2] MODE, [SE(77)] ONLY, IN COLLISION GAS [HE] MODE INCLUDE [AL27), AS(75), B(11), CO(59), CR(52), CU(65), FE(56), MN(55), NI(60), SR(86), TI(47), V(51), AND ZN(66)] AND IN NORMAL MODE INCLUDE [AG(107), BA(135), BE(9), BI(209), CD(111), CE(140), CS(133), GA(71), LA(139), LI(7), MO(98), NB(93), PB(208), PD(106), PT(195), RB(85), SB(121), SN(120), TL(205), U(238), W(184), Y(89)]. NLET, BURLINGTON, METHOD 02-2004. REQUESTED DECEMBER 2009.

METALS IN WATER, DISSOLVED, "IN BOTTLE" DIGESTION, ICP-MS: THE WHOLE WATER SAMPLE IS FILTERED THROUGH A 0.45 MICRON CELLULOSE ACETATE FILTER PAPER AND THE FILTRATE STORED IN A HDPE OR TEFLON BOTTLE. THE CONTAINER IS DE-CAPPED IN A CLASS 100 WORKSTATION, ACIDIFIED TO 2% (V/V) HNO3 AND RECAPPED. THE SAMPLE IS "IN-BOTTLE" DIGESTED IN A CONVECTION OVEN, SET AT 65 DEGREES C FOR 16 HOURS (OVERNIGHT). THE SAMPLE IS COOLED AND INTRODUCED TO AN INDUCTIVELY COUPLED ARGON PLASMA-COLLISION/REACTION CELL MASS SPECTROMETER (CRC-ICP-MS) BY DISCRETE SAMPLING PNEUMATIC NEBULIZATION. EACH RESPECTIVE ELEMENT IS MEASURED AT A SPECIFIC MASS TO CHARGE RATIO, M/Z VALUE EXPRESSED IN AMU (ATOMIC MASS UNITS). PARAMETERS ANALYZED IN REACTION GAS [H2] MODE, [SE(77)] ONLY, IN COLLISION GAS [HE] MODE INCLUDE [AL27), AS(75), B(11), CO(59), CR(52), CU(65), FE(56), MN(55), NI(60), SR(86), TI(47), V(51), AND ZN(66)] AND IN NORMAL MODE INCLUDE [AG(107), BA(135), BE(9), BI(209), CD(111), CE(140), CS(133), GA(71), LA(139), LI(7), MO(98), NB(93), PB(208), PD(106), PT(195), RB(85), SB(121), SN(120), TL(205), U(238), W(184), Y(89)]. NLET, BURLINGTON, METHOD 02-2004. REQUESTED DECEMBER 2009.

PHOSPHORUS, TOTAL, PARTICULATE-  A KNOWN VOLUME OF SAMPLE IS FILTERED THROUGH A GF/C GLASS FIBRE FILTER PAPER. THE FILTER IS PLACED IN A SAMPLE CONTAINER (100 ML FLINT GLASS BOTTLE), AND 100 ML PHOSPHORUS FREE WATER IS ADDED.  IT IS PRESERVED BY ADDING 1.0 ML OF 30% SULPHURIC ACID SOLUTION.  IN THE LABORATORY, 300 UL OF SATURATED POTASSIUM PERSULPHATE SOLUTION IS ADDED.  IT IS THAN DIGESTED IN AN AUTOCLAVE FOR 30 MINUTES AT 123 C AND 20 PSI. THE OXIDATIVE-ACID DIGESTION RELEASES ORGANICALLY BOUND PHOSPHOROUS AS ORTHOPHOSPHATE, PO4. ORTHOPHOSPHATE IS ALSO FORMED IN THE DIGESTION FROM THE HYDROLYSIS OF INORGANIC CONDENSED PHOSPHOROUS (PYRO-, META-, AND OTHER POLYPHOSPHATES).  THE DIGEST IS ANALYZED IN A CONTINUOUS SEGMENTED FLOW ANALYZER (CFA) WHERE THE ORTHOPHOSPHATE IS REACTED IN AN ACID MEDIUM WITH AMMONIUM MOLYBDATE TO FORM HETEROPOLY MOLYBDOPHOSPHORIC ACID, H3(PMo3o10)4. THIS IS THEN REDUCED WITH STANNOUS CHLORIDE TO FORM THE MOLYBDENUM BLUE COMPLEX. THE ABSORPTION OF RADIATION BY THE COMPLEX REPRESENTS THE TOTAL PHOSPHOROUS CONCENTRATION IN THE SAMPLE  AND IS DETERMINED BY THE CFA PHOTOMETER AT 660 NM WAVELENGTH.
BURLINGTON, NLET, METHOD 01-1190.  REQUESTED MAY 2010.

IONS BY ION CHROMATOGRAPHY, HYDOXIDE ELUENT, DISSOLVED - A WHOLE WATER SAMPLE IS FILTERED THROUGH A 0.45 UM CELLULOSE ACETATE MEMBRANE FILTER. THE ANALYSIS OF THE ANIONS, FLUORIDE, CHLORIDE, NITRATE AND SULPHATE ON AN ALIQUOT OF THE FILTRATE IS CONDUCTED BY ION CHROMATOGRAPHY. THIS CHROMATOGRAPHIC SEPARATION METHOD IS BASED ON AN ION EXCHANGE PROCESS OCCURRING BETWEEN THE MOBILE ELUENT PHASE AND ION-EXCHANGE GROUP BONDED TO THE SUPPORT MATERIAL. THE POTASSIUM HYDROXIDE, KOH, ELUENT IS PRODUCED ELECTROLYTICALLY, IN SITU, IN A ELUENT GENERATOR (EG) SYSTEM BASED ON THE ADDITION OF WATER TO A KOH GENERATOR CARTRIDGE. ANY ANIONS, IN PARTICULAR, CARBONATE IONS, INTRODUCED INTO THE SYSTEM BY THE DEIONIZED WATER ARE CONTAMINANTS, AND ARE REMOVED BY A CONTINUOUS GENERATING ANION TRAP COLUMN (CR-ATC) PLACED BEFORE THE SAMPLE INJECTION VALVE. THE WATER SAMPLE IS EJECTED INTO THE ELUENT STREAM. IT IS THEN PUMPED THROUGH A GUARD COLUMN AND AN ANALYTICAL HYDROXIDE-SELECTIVE ION EXCHANGE COLUMN WHERE THE ION SEPARATION OCCURS. THE IONS OF INTEREST ARE SEPARATED BASED ON THE AFFINITY FOR THE EXCHANGE SITES OF THE RESIN BED. THE SAMPLE IS THEN PUMPED THROUGH THE SUPPRESSOR WHICH REDUCES THE BACKGROUND CONDUCTIVITY OF THE ELUENT TO A NEGLIGIBLE LEVEL, BY REMOVING THE KOH FROM THE ANALYTICAL STREAM AND CONVERTING THE ANIONS OF THE SAMPLE TO THEIR RESPECTIVE ACID FORMS (HF, HCI, HNO3, AND H2SO4). ANY CARBONIC ACID PRODUCED DUE TO THE PRESENCE OF CARBONATE IN THE SAMPLE, MAY INTERFERE WITH ANALYTE PEAKS, AND IS MINIMIZED BY THE USE OF CARBONATE REMOVAL DEVICE (CRD). THE CONCENTRATIONS OF THESE SEPARATED ANIONS ARE DETERMINED BY MEASURING THEIR RESPECTIVE CONDUCTIVITIES USING A CONDUCTIVITY DETECTOR. ANIONS ARE IDENTIFIED CHROMATOGRAPHICALLY BY THEIR RETENTION TIMES AND QUANTIFIED BY COMPARING THEIR PEAK INTEGRATIONS WITH KNOW CALIBRATION STANDARDS. NLET, BURLINGTON, METHOD 01-1081. REQUESTED DECEMBER 2010.

ANIONS ARE IDENTIFIED CHROMATOGRAPHICALLY BY THEIR RETENTION TIMES AND QUANTIFIED BY COMPARING THEIR PEAK INTEGRATIONS WITH KNOW CALIBRATION STANDARDS. NLET, BURLINGTON, METHOD 01-1081. REQUESTED DECEMBER 2010.

IONS BY ION CHROMATOGRAPHY, HYDOXIDE ELUENT, UNFILTERED (DECANTED) - A WHOLE WATER SAMPLE IS DECANTED INTO AN ION CHROMOTAGRAPH SAMPLER CUP. THE ANALYSIS OF THE ANIONS, FLUORIDE, CHLORIDE, NITRATE AND SULPHATE ON THE DECANTED  ALIQUOT IS CONDUCTED BY ION CHROMATOGRAPHY. THIS CHROMATOGRAPHIC SEPARATION METHOD IS BASED ON AN ION EXCHANGE PROCESS OCCURRING BETWEEN THE MOBILE ELUENT PHASE AND ION-EXCHANGE GROUP BONDED TO THE SUPPORT MATERIAL. THE POTASSIUM HYDROXIDE, KOH, ELUENT IS PRODUCED ELECTROLYTICALLY, IN SITU, IN A ELUENT GENERATOR (EG) SYSTEM BASED ON THE ADDITION OF WATER TO A KOH GENERATOR CARTRIDGE. ANY ANIONS, IN PARTICULAR, CARBONATE IONS, INTRODUCED INTO THE SYSTEM BY THE DEIONIZED WATER ARE CONTAMINANTS, AND ARE REMOVED BY A CONTINUOUS GENERATING ANION TRAP COLUMN (CR-ATC) PLACED BEFORE THE SAMPLE INJECTION VALVE. THE WATER SAMPLE IS EJECTED INTO THE ELUENT STREAM. IT IS THEN PUMPED THROUGH A GUARD COLUMN AND AN ANALYTICAL HYDROXIDE-SELECTIVE ION EXCHANGE COLUMN WHERE THE ION SEPARATION OCCURS. THE IONS OF INTEREST ARE SEPARATED BASED ON THE AFFINITY FOR THE EXCHANGE SITES OF THE RESIN BED. THE SAMPLE IS THEN PUMPED THROUGH THE SUPPRESSOR WHICH REDUCES THE BACKGROUND CONDUCTIVITY OF THE ELUENT TO A NEGLIGIBLE LEVEL, BY REMOVING THE KOH FROM THE ANALYTICAL STREAM AND CONVERTING THE ANIONS OF THE SAMPLE TO THEIR RESPECTIVE ACID FORMS (HF, HCI, HNO3, AND H2SO4). ANY CARBONIC ACID PRODUCED DUE TO THE PRESENCE OF CARBONATE IN THE SAMPLE, MAY INTERFERE WITH ANALYTE PEAKS, AND IS MINIMIZED BY THE USE OF CARBONATE REMOVAL DEVICE (CRD). THE CONCENTRATIONS OF THESE SEPARATED ANIONS ARE DETERMINED BY MEASURING THEIR RESPECTIVE CONDUCTIVITIES USING A CONDUCTIVITY DETECTOR. ANIONS ARE IDENTIFIED CHROMATOGRAPHICALLY BY THEIR RETENTION TIMES AND QUANTIFIED BY COMPARING THEIR PEAK INTEGRATIONS WITH KNOW CALIBRATION STANDARDS. NLET, BURLINGTON, METHOD 01-1081. REQUESTED DECEMBER 2010.

TOTAL RECOVERABLE METALS IN SEDIMENT, BY AQUA-REGIA, HOT BLOCK DIGESTION - METALS EXTRACTED BY THIS PROCEDURE ARE TAKEN TO REPRESENT THE "ENVIRONMENTALLY AVAILABLE" METALS. THERE IS NO DESTRUCTION OF SILICATES. THE PROCEDURE IS, AS FOLLOWS: ONE-HALF GRAM OF HOMOGENEOUS FREEZE-DRIED SEDIMENT IS WEIGHED INTO A TEFLON (PFA) 60 ML DIGESTION TUBE AND 1.5 ML OF NITRIC ACID IS ADDED. THE TUBE IS SHAKEN, THE REACTION ALLOWED TO SETTLE AND 4.5 ML OF HCI IS ADDED. THE TUBE IS SHAKEN AGAIN AND THE SOLUTION ALLOWED TO SETTLE OVERNIGHT. NEXT DAY, THE SAMPLE TUBE IS PLACED ON A HOT BLOCK DIGESTION SYSTEM AND ALLOWED TO SIT FOR ONE HOUR AT 60o C. IT IS RAMPED FROM 60o C TO 80o C. THE UNIT IS SET UP FOR A RAMP TIME OF ONE HOUR. IT IS THEN RAMPED FROM 80o C TO 100o C. THIS SHOULD TAKE AN ADDITIONAL HOUR. THE SAMPLE IS THEN ALLOWED TO DIGEST AT 100o C FOR 4 HOURS. SAMPLES THAT HAVE REACHED NEAR DRYNESS, APPROXIMATELY 1 ML OF DIGEST, ARE REMOVED FROM THE HOT BLOCK. IF THE SAMPLE IS NOT AT NEAR DRYNESS, THE TEMPERATURE IS RAMPLED TO 120 o C AND THE SAMPLES ARE REMOVED AS THEY REACH NEAR DRYNESS. THE COMBINATION OF TEMPERATURE AND THE STRONG OXIDIZING CONDITIONS ENSURES DESTRUCTION OF THE ORGANIC AND INORGANIC COMPONENTS OF THE SUBSTRATE. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SILICEOUS BOUND ELEMENTS, THE AQUA-REGIA DIGESTION PROVIDES EFFECTIVE EXTRACTION OF ANALYTES OF INTEREST. THE DIGEST IS ALLOWED TO COOL OVERNIGHT. IT IS DILUTED TO 100 ML WITH REAGENT WATER AND PLACED IN A TEFLON (PFA) BOTTLE. THE FOLLOWING DAY, THE SOLUTION IS DECANTED INTO A 60 ML HDPE BOTTLE. THE SAMPLE IS THEN DILUTED APPROPRIATELY AND ANALYZED BY AN INDUCTIVELY COUPLED ARGON PLASMA - COLLISION/REACTION CELL MASS SPECTROMETER (CRC-ICP-MS) USING DISCRETE SAMPLING PNUEMATIC NEBULIZATION. EACH RESPECTIVE ELEMENT IS MEASURED AT A SPECIFIC MASS TO CHARGE RATION, M/Z VALUE EXPRESSED IN AMU (ATOMIC MASS UNITS). PARAMETERS ANALYZED IN REACTION GAS {H2} MODE, [SE(77)] ONLY; IN COLLISION GAS {HE} MODE INCLUDE [AL(27), AS(75), B(11), CA(43), CO(59), CR(52), CU(65), FE(56), K(39), MG(26), MN(55), NA(23), NI(60), P(31), SC(45), SR(86), TI(47), V(51), ZN(66), ZR(90)]); IN COLLISION GAS {XE} MODE [S(32)] ONLY; AND IN NORMAL NO GAS MODE INCLUDE [AG(107), BA(135), BE(9), BI(209), CD(111), CE(140), CS(133), GA(71), GD(160), LA(139), LI(7), MO(98), NB(93), PB(208), PD(106), PT(195), RB(85), RH(103), SB(121), SN(120), TI(205), U(238), W(184), Y(89)]. THE RESULTS ARE REPORTED ON A DRY WEIGHT BASIS. NLET, BURLINGTON, METHOD 02-2404. REQUESTED DECEMBER 2010. THE METHOD IS MODIFIED FROM THE AQUA-REGIA EXTACTION METHOD HMARSOIL-E3062A USED BY THE ONTARIO MINISTRY OF THE ENVIRONMENT.

TOTAL RECOVERABLE METALS IN SEDIMENT, BY AQUA-REGIA, HOT BLOCK DIGESTION - METALS EXTRACTED BY THIS PROCEDURE ARE TAKEN TO REPRESENT THE "ENVIRONMENTALLY AVAILABLE" METALS. THERE IS NO DESTRUCTION OF SILICATES. THE PROCEDURE IS, AS FOLLOWS: ONE-HALF GRAM OF HOMOGENEOUS FREEZE-DRIED SEDIMENT IS WEIGHED INTO A TEFLON (PFA) 60 ML DIGESTION TUBE AND 1.5 ML OF NITRIC ACID IS ADDED. THE TUBE IS SHAKEN, THE REACTION ALLOWED TO SETTLE AND 4.5 ML OF HCI IS ADDED. THE TUBE IS SHAKEN AGAIN AND THE SOLUTION ALLOWED TO SETTLE OVERNIGHT. NEXT DAY, THE SAMPLE TUBE IS PLACED ON A HOT BLOCK DIGESTION SYSTEM AND ALLOWED TO SIT FOR ONE HOUR AT 60o C. IT IS RAMPED FROM 60o C TO 80o C. THE UNIT IS SET UP FOR A RAMP TIME OF ONE HOUR. IT IS THEN RAMPED FROM 80o C TO 100o C. THIS SHOULD TAKE AN ADDITIONAL HOUR. THE SAMPLE IS THEN ALLOWED TO DIGEST AT 100o C FOR 4 HOURS. SAMPLES THAT HAVE REACHED NEAR DRYNESS, APPROXIMATELY 1 ML OF DIGEST, ARE REMOVED FROM THE HOT BLOCK. IF THE SAMPLE IS NOT AT NEAR DRYNESS, THE TEMPERATURE IS RAMPLED TO 120 o C AND THE SAMPLES ARE REMOVED AS THEY REACH NEAR DRYNESS. THE COMBINATION OF TEMPERATURE AND THE STRONG OXIDIZING CONDITIONS ENSURES DESTRUCTION OF THE ORGANIC AND INORGANIC COMPONENTS OF THE SUBSTRATE. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SILICEOUS BOUND ELEMENTS, THE AQUA-REGIA DIGESTION PROVIDES EFFECTIVE EXTRACTION OF ANALYTES OF INTEREST. THE DIGEST IS ALLOWED TO COOL OVERNIGHT. IT IS DILUTED TO 100 ML WITH REAGENT WATER AND PLACED IN A TEFLON (PFA) BOTTLE. THE FOLLOWING DAY, THE SOLUTION IS DECANTED INTO A 60 ML HDPE BOTTLE. THE SAMPLE IS THEN DILUTED APPROPRIATELY AND ANALYZED BY AN INDUCTIVELY COUPLED ARGON PLASMA - COLLISION/REACTION CELL MASS SPECTROMETER (CRC-ICP-MS) USING DISCRETE SAMPLING PNUEMATIC NEBULIZATION. EACH RESPECTIVE ELEMENT IS MEASURED AT A SPECIFIC MASS TO CHARGE RATION, M/Z VALUE EXPRESSED IN AMU (ATOMIC MASS UNITS). PARAMETERS ANALYZED IN REACTION GAS {H2} MODE, [SE(77)] ONLY; IN COLLISION GAS {HE} MODE INCLUDE [AL(27), AS(75), B(11), CA(43), CO(59), CR(52), CU(65), FE(56), K(39), MG(26), MN(55), NA(23), NI(60), P(31), SC(45), SR(86), TI(47), V(51), ZN(66), ZR(90)]); IN COLLISION GAS {XE} MODE [S(32)] ONLY; AND IN NORMAL NO GAS MODE INCLUDE [AG(107), BA(135), BE(9), BI(209), CD(111), CE(140), CS(133), GA(71), GD(160), LA(139), LI(7), MO(98), NB(93), PB(208), PD(106), PT(195), RB(85), RH(103), SB(121), SN(120), TI(205), U(238), W(184), Y(89)]. THE RESULTS ARE REPORTED ON A DRY WEIGHT BASIS. NLET, BURLINGTON, METHOD 02-2404. REQUESTED DECEMBER 2010. THE METHOD IS MODIFIED FROM THE AQUA-REGIA EXTACTION METHOD HMARSOIL-E3062A USED BY THE ONTARIO MINISTRY OF THE ENVIRONMENT.

IF THE SAMPLE IS NOT AT NEAR DRYNESS, THE TEMPERATURE IS RAMPLED TO 120 o C AND THE SAMPLES ARE REMOVED AS THEY REACH NEAR DRYNESS. THE COMBINATION OF TEMPERATURE AND THE STRONG OXIDIZING CONDITIONS ENSURES DESTRUCTION OF THE ORGANIC AND INORGANIC COMPONENTS OF THE SUBSTRATE. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SILICEOUS BOUND ELEMENTS, THE AQUA-REGIA DIGESTION PROVIDES EFFECTIVE EXTRACTION OF ANALYTES OF INTEREST. THE DIGEST IS ALLOWED TO COOL OVERNIGHT. IT IS DILUTED TO 100 ML WITH REAGENT WATER AND PLACED IN A TEFLON (PFA) BOTTLE. THE FOLLOWING DAY, THE SOLUTION IS DECANTED INTO A 60 ML HDPE BOTTLE. THE SAMPLE IS THEN DILUTED APPROPRIATELY AND ANALYZED BY AN INDUCTIVELY COUPLED ARGON PLASMA - COLLISION/REACTION CELL MASS SPECTROMETER (CRC-ICP-MS) USING DISCRETE SAMPLING PNUEMATIC NEBULIZATION. THERE IS NO DESTRUCTION OF SILICATES. THE PROCEDURE IS, AS FOLLOWS: ONE-HALF GRAM OF HOMOGENEOUS FREEZE-DRIED SEDIMENT IS WEIGHED INTO A TEFLON (PFA) 60 ML DIGESTION TUBE AND 1.5 ML OF NITRIC ACID IS ADDED. THE TUBE IS SHAKEN, THE REACTION ALLOWED TO SETTLE AND 4.5 ML OF HCI IS ADDED. THE TUBE IS SHAKEN AGAIN AND THE SOLUTION ALLOWED TO SETTLE OVERNIGHT. NEXT DAY, THE SAMPLE TUBE IS PLACED ON A HOT BLOCK DIGESTION SYSTEM AND ALLOWED TO SIT FOR ONE HOUR AT 60o C. IT IS RAMPED FROM 60o C TO 80o C. THE UNIT IS SET UP FOR A RAMP TIME OF ONE HOUR. IT IS THEN RAMPED FROM 80o C TO 100o C. THIS SHOULD TAKE AN ADDITIONAL HOUR. THE SAMPLE IS THEN ALLOWED TO DIGEST AT 100o C FOR 4 HOURS. SAMPLES THAT HAVE REACHED NEAR DRYNESS, APPROXIMATELY 1 ML OF DIGEST, ARE REMOVED FROM THE HOT BLOCK. IF THE SAMPLE IS NOT AT NEAR DRYNESS, THE TEMPERATURE IS RAMPLED TO 120 o C AND THE SAMPLES ARE REMOVED AS THEY REACH NEAR DRYNESS. THE COMBINATION OF TEMPERATURE AND THE STRONG OXIDIZING CONDITIONS ENSURES DESTRUCTION OF THE ORGANIC AND INORGANIC COMPONENTS OF THE SUBSTRATE. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SILICEOUS BOUND ELEMENTS, THE AQUA-REGIA DIGESTION PROVIDES EFFECTIVE EXTRACTION OF ANALYTES OF INTEREST. THE DIGEST IS ALLOWED TO COOL OVERNIGHT. IT IS DILUTED TO 100 ML WITH REAGENT WATER AND PLACED IN A TEFLON (PFA) BOTTLE. THE FOLLOWING DAY, THE SOLUTION IS DECANTED INTO A 60 ML HDPE BOTTLE. THE SAMPLE IS THEN DILUTED APPROPRIATELY AND ANALYZED BY AN INDUCTIVELY COUPLED ARGON PLASMA - COLLISION/REACTION CELL MASS SPECTROMETER (CRC-ICP-MS) USING DISCRETE SAMPLING PNUEMATIC NEBULIZATION. EACH RESPECTIVE ELEMENT IS MEASURED AT A SPECIFIC MASS TO CHARGE RATION, M/Z VALUE EXPRESSED IN AMU (ATOMIC MASS UNITS). PARAMETERS ANALYZED IN REACTION GAS {H2} MODE, [SE(77)] ONLY; IN COLLISION GAS {HE} MODE INCLUDE [AL(27), AS(75), B(11), CA(43), CO(59), CR(52), CU(65), FE(56), K(39), MG(26), MN(55), NA(23), NI(60), P(31), SC(45), SR(86), TI(47), V(51), ZN(66), ZR(90)]); IN COLLISION GAS {XE} MODE [S(32)] ONLY; AND IN NORMAL NO GAS MODE INCLUDE [AG(107), BA(135), BE(9), BI(209), CD(111), CE(140), CS(133), GA(71), GD(160), LA(139), LI(7), MO(98), NB(93), PB(208), PD(106), PT(195), RB(85), RH(103), SB(121), SN(120), TI(205), U(238), W(184), Y(89)]. THE RESULTS ARE REPORTED ON A DRY WEIGHT BASIS. NLET, BURLINGTON, METHOD 02-2404. REQUESTED DECEMBER 2010. THE METHOD IS MODIFIED FROM THE AQUA-REGIA EXTACTION METHOD HMARSOIL-E3062A USED BY THE ONTARIO MINISTRY OF THE ENVIRONMENT.

TOTAL RECOVERABLE METALS IN SEDIMENT, BY AQUA-REGIA, HOT BLOCK DIGESTION - METALS EXTRACTED BY THIS PROCEDURE ARE TAKEN TO REPRESENT THE "ENVIRONMENTALLY AVAILABLE" METALS. THERE IS NO DESTRUCTION OF SILICATES. THE PROCEDURE IS, AS FOLLOWS: ONE-HALF GRAM OF HOMOGENEOUS FREEZE-DRIED SEDIMENT IS WEIGHED INTO A TEFLON (PFA) 60 ML DIGESTION TUBE AND 1.5 ML OF NITRIC ACID IS ADDED. THE TUBE IS SHAKEN, THE REACTION ALLOWED TO SETTLE AND 4.5 ML OF HCI IS ADDED. THE TUBE IS SHAKEN AGAIN AND THE SOLUTION ALLOWED TO SETTLE OVERNIGHT. NEXT DAY, THE SAMPLE TUBE IS PLACED ON A HOT BLOCK DIGESTION SYSTEM AND ALLOWED TO SIT FOR ONE HOUR AT 60o C. IT IS RAMPED FROM 60o C TO 80o C. THE UNIT IS SET UP FOR A RAMP TIME OF ONE HOUR. IT IS THEN RAMPED FROM 80o C TO 100o C. THIS SHOULD TAKE AN ADDITIONAL HOUR. THE SAMPLE IS THEN ALLOWED TO DIGEST AT 100o C FOR 4 HOURS. SAMPLES THAT HAVE REACHED NEAR DRYNESS, APPROXIMATELY 1 ML OF DIGEST, ARE REMOVED FROM THE HOT BLOCK. IF THE SAMPLE IS NOT AT NEAR DRYNESS, THE TEMPERATURE IS RAMPLED TO 120 o C AND THE SAMPLES ARE REMOVED AS THEY REACH NEAR DRYNESS. THE COMBINATION OF TEMPERATURE AND THE STRONG OXIDIZING CONDITIONS ENSURES DESTRUCTION OF THE ORGANIC AND INORGANIC COMPONENTS OF THE SUBSTRATE. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SILICEOUS BOUND ELEMENTS, THE AQUA-REGIA DIGESTION PROVIDES EFFECTIVE EXTRACTION OF ANALYTES OF INTEREST. THE DIGEST IS ALLOWED TO COOL OVERNIGHT. IT IS DILUTED TO 100 ML WITH REAGENT WATER AND PLACED IN A TEFLON (PFA) BOTTLE. THE FOLLOWING DAY, THE SOLUTION IS DECANTED INTO A 60 ML HDPE BOTTLE. THE SAMPLE IS THEN DILUTED APPROPRIATELY AND ANALYZED BY AN INDUCTIVELY COUPLED ARGON PLASMA - COLLISION/REACTION CELL MASS SPECTROMETER (CRC-ICP-MS) USING DISCRETE SAMPLING PNUEMATIC NEBULIZATION. EACH RESPECTIVE ELEMENT IS MEASURED AT A SPECIFIC MASS TO CHARGE RATION, M/Z VALUE EXPRESSED IN AMU (ATOMIC MASS UNITS). PARAMETERS ANALYZED IN REACTION GAS {H2} MODE, [SE(77)] ONLY; IN COLLISION GAS {HE} MODE INCLUDE [AL(27), AS(75), B(11), CA(43), CO(59), CR(52), CU(65), FE(56), K(39), MG(26), MN(55), NA(23), NI(60), P(31), SC(45), SR(86), TI(47), V(51), ZN(66), ZR(90)]); IN COLLISION GAS {XE} MODE [S(32)] ONLY; AND IN NORMAL NO GAS MODE INCLUDE [AG(107), BA(135), BE(9), BI(209), CD(111), CE(140), CS(133), GA(71), GD(160), LA(139), LI(7), MO(98), NB(93), PB(208), PD(106), PT(195), RB(85), RH(103), SB(121), SN(120), TI(205), U(238), W(184), Y(89)]. THE RESULTS ARE REPORTED ON A DRY WEIGHT BASIS. NLET, BURLINGTON, METHOD 02-2404. REQUESTED DECEMBER 2010. THE METHOD IS MODIFIED FROM THE AQUA-REGIA EXTACTION METHOD HMARSOIL-E3062A USED BY THE ONTARIO MINISTRY OF THE ENVIRONMENT.

IF THE SAMPLE IS NOT AT NEAR DRYNESS, THE TEMPERATURE IS RAMPLED TO 120 o C AND THE SAMPLES ARE REMOVED AS THEY REACH NEAR DRYNESS. THE COMBINATION OF TEMPERATURE AND THE STRONG OXIDIZING CONDITIONS ENSURES DESTRUCTION OF THE ORGANIC AND INORGANIC COMPONENTS OF THE SUBSTRATE. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SILICEOUS BOUND ELEMENTS, THE AQUA-REGIA DIGESTION PROVIDES EFFECTIVE EXTRACTION OF ANALYTES OF INTEREST. THE DIGEST IS ALLOWED TO COOL OVERNIGHT. IT IS DILUTED TO 100 ML WITH REAGENT WATER AND PLACED IN A TEFLON (PFA) BOTTLE. THE FOLLOWING DAY, THE SOLUTION IS DECANTED INTO A 60 ML HDPE BOTTLE. THE SAMPLE IS THEN DILUTED APPROPRIATELY AND ANALYZED BY AN INDUCTIVELY COUPLED ARGON PLASMA - COLLISION/REACTION CELL MASS SPECTROMETER (CRC-ICP-MS) USING DISCRETE SAMPLING PNUEMATIC NEBULIZATION.
