THERE IS NO DESTRUCTION OF SILICATES. THE PROCEDURE IS, AS FOLLOWS: ONE-HALF GRAM OF HOMOGENEOUS FREEZE-DRIED SEDIMENT IS WEIGHED INTO A TEFLON (PFA) 60 ML DIGESTION TUBE AND 1.5 ML OF NITRIC ACID IS ADDED. THE TUBE IS SHAKEN, THE REACTION ALLOWED TO SETTLE AND 4.5 ML OF HCI IS ADDED. THE TUBE IS SHAKEN AGAIN AND THE SOLUTION ALLOWED TO SETTLE OVERNIGHT. NEXT DAY, THE SAMPLE TUBE IS PLACED ON A HOT BLOCK DIGESTION SYSTEM AND ALLOWED TO SIT FOR ONE HOUR AT 60o C. IT IS RAMPED FROM 60o C TO 80o C. THE UNIT IS SET UP FOR A RAMP TIME OF ONE HOUR. IT IS THEN RAMPED FROM 80o C TO 100o C. THIS SHOULD TAKE AN ADDITIONAL HOUR. THE SAMPLE IS THEN ALLOWED TO DIGEST AT 100o C FOR 4 HOURS. SAMPLES THAT HAVE REACHED NEAR DRYNESS, APPROXIMATELY 1 ML OF DIGEST, ARE REMOVED FROM THE HOT BLOCK. IF THE SAMPLE IS NOT AT NEAR DRYNESS, THE TEMPERATURE IS RAMPLED TO 120 o C AND THE SAMPLES ARE REMOVED AS THEY REACH NEAR DRYNESS. THE COMBINATION OF TEMPERATURE AND THE STRONG OXIDIZING CONDITIONS ENSURES DESTRUCTION OF THE ORGANIC AND INORGANIC COMPONENTS OF THE SUBSTRATE. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SILICEOUS BOUND ELEMENTS, THE AQUA-REGIA DIGESTION PROVIDES EFFECTIVE EXTRACTION OF ANALYTES OF INTEREST. THE DIGEST IS ALLOWED TO COOL OVERNIGHT. IT IS DILUTED TO 100 ML WITH REAGENT WATER AND PLACED IN A TEFLON (PFA) BOTTLE. THE FOLLOWING DAY, THE SOLUTION IS DECANTED INTO A 60 ML HDPE BOTTLE. THE SAMPLE IS THEN DILUTED APPROPRIATELY AND ANALYZED BY AN INDUCTIVELY COUPLED ARGON PLASMA - COLLISION/REACTION CELL MASS SPECTROMETER (CRC-ICP-MS) USING DISCRETE SAMPLING PNUEMATIC NEBULIZATION. EACH RESPECTIVE ELEMENT IS MEASURED AT A SPECIFIC MASS TO CHARGE RATION, M/Z VALUE EXPRESSED IN AMU (ATOMIC MASS UNITS). PARAMETERS ANALYZED IN REACTION GAS {H2} MODE, [SE(77)] ONLY; IN COLLISION GAS {HE} MODE INCLUDE [AL(27), AS(75), B(11), CA(43), CO(59), CR(52), CU(65), FE(56), K(39), MG(26), MN(55), NA(23), NI(60), P(31), SC(45), SR(86), TI(47), V(51), ZN(66), ZR(90)]); IN COLLISION GAS {XE} MODE [S(32)] ONLY; AND IN NORMAL NO GAS MODE INCLUDE [AG(107), BA(135), BE(9), BI(209), CD(111), CE(140), CS(133), GA(71), GD(160), LA(139), LI(7), MO(98), NB(93), PB(208), PD(106), PT(195), RB(85), RH(103), SB(121), SN(120), TI(205), U(238), W(184), Y(89)]. THE RESULTS ARE REPORTED ON A DRY WEIGHT BASIS. NLET, BURLINGTON, METHOD 02-2404. REQUESTED DECEMBER 2010. THE METHOD IS MODIFIED FROM THE AQUA-REGIA EXTACTION METHOD HMARSOIL-E3062A USED BY THE ONTARIO MINISTRY OF THE ENVIRONMENT.

TOTAL METALS IN SEDIMENT, BY MICROWAVE ASSISTED ACID DIGESTION INCLUDING HF - TOTAL METALS ANALYSIS REQUIRES THE COMPLETE DESTRUCTION OF THE SAMPLE IN ORDER TO RELEASE ALL FORMS OF METAL. THE PROCEDURE, IS A MODIFICATION OF ENVIRODAT METHOD 2940 AND IS DESCRIBED AS FOLLOWS: ONE-HALF GRAM OF FREEZE DRIED SEDIMENT IS WEIGHED INTO A TFM TEFLON VESSEL AND A MIXTURE OF NITRIC ACID, HYDROCHLORIC ACID AND HYDROGEN PEROXIDE (9:2:1 ML) IS ADDED. THE VESSEL IS ASSEMBLED, SEALED AND FITTED ONTO A MICROWAVE ROTOR WHICH IS PLACED IN A HIGH PRESSURE MICROWAVE OVEN. THE SAMPLE IS DIGESTED AND THE TEMPERATURE IS MAINTAINED AT 200o C FOR 15 MINUTES. THE VESSEL IS REMOVED FROM THE MICROWAVE OVEN AND THE COOLED DIGEST IS TRANSFERRED TO A TEFLON DIGESTION TUBE. THE SAMPLE VOLUME IS THEN REDUCED ON A HOT BLOCK AT 130o C TO NEAR DRYNESS (~1 ML), FOLLOWED BY TREATMENT WITH 10 ML HYDROFLUORIC ACID, OVERNIGHT AT 90o C, TO ENSURE DESTRUCTION OF SILICATES. THE EXCESS HYDROFLUORIC ACID IS BOILED OFF AND THE SALTS ARE DISSOLVED IN A SOLUTION OF 5% HYDROCHLORIC ACID. THE 100 ML RESULTANT SOLUTION IS DILUTED APPROPRIATELY AND ANALYZED BY AN INDUCTIVELY COUPLED ARGON PLASMA- COLLISION/REACTION CELL MASS SPECTROMETER (CRC-ICP-MS) USING DISCRETE SAMPLING PNUEMATIC NEBULIZATION. EACH RESPECTIVE ELEMENT IS MEASURED AT A SPECIFIC MASS TO CHARGE RATIO, M/Z VALUE EXPRESSED IN AMU (ATOMIC MASS UNITS). PARAMETERS ANALYZED IN REACTION GAS {H2} MODE, [SE(77)] ONLY; IN COLLISION GAS {HE} MODE INCLUDE [AL(27), AS(75), B(11), CA(43), CO(59), CR(52), CU(65), FE(56), K(39), MG(26), MN(55), NA(23), NI(60), P(31), SC(45), SR(86), TI(47), V(51), ZN(66), ZR(90)]); IN COLLISION GAS {XE} MODE [S(32)] ONLY; AND IN NORMAL NO GAS MODE INCLUDE [AG(107), BA(135), BE(9), BI(209), CD(111), CE(140), CS(133), GA(71), GD(160), LA(139), LI(7), MO(98), NB(93), PB(208), PD(106), PT(195), RB(85), RH(103), SB(121), SN(120), TI(205), U(238), W(184), Y(89)]. THE RESULTS ARE REPORTED ON A DRY WEIGHT BASIS. NLET, BURLINGTON, METHOD 02-2405. REQUESTED DECEMBER 2010. THE METHOD IS MODIFIED FROM EPA METHOD NUMBER 2052.

THE PROCEDURE, IS A MODIFICATION OF ENVIRODAT METHOD 2940 AND IS DESCRIBED AS FOLLOWS: ONE-HALF GRAM OF FREEZE DRIED SEDIMENT IS WEIGHED INTO A TFM TEFLON VESSEL AND A MIXTURE OF NITRIC ACID, HYDROCHLORIC ACID AND HYDROGEN PEROXIDE (9:2:1 ML) IS ADDED. THE VESSEL IS ASSEMBLED, SEALED AND FITTED ONTO A MICROWAVE ROTOR WHICH IS PLACED IN A HIGH PRESSURE MICROWAVE OVEN. THE SAMPLE IS DIGESTED AND THE TEMPERATURE IS MAINTAINED AT 200o C FOR 15 MINUTES. THE VESSEL IS REMOVED FROM THE MICROWAVE OVEN AND THE COOLED DIGEST IS TRANSFERRED TO A TEFLON DIGESTION TUBE. THE SAMPLE VOLUME IS THEN REDUCED ON A HOT BLOCK AT 130o C TO NEAR DRYNESS (~1 ML), FOLLOWED BY TREATMENT WITH 10 ML HYDROFLUORIC ACID, OVERNIGHT AT 90o C, TO ENSURE DESTRUCTION OF SILICATES. THE EXCESS HYDROFLUORIC ACID IS BOILED OFF AND THE SALTS ARE DISSOLVED IN A SOLUTION OF 5% HYDROCHLORIC ACID. THE 100 ML RESULTANT SOLUTION IS DILUTED APPROPRIATELY AND ANALYZED BY AN INDUCTIVELY COUPLED ARGON PLASMA- COLLISION/REACTION CELL MASS SPECTROMETER (CRC-ICP-MS) USING DISCRETE SAMPLING PNUEMATIC NEBULIZATION. EACH RESPECTIVE ELEMENT IS MEASURED AT A SPECIFIC MASS TO CHARGE RATIO, M/Z VALUE EXPRESSED IN AMU (ATOMIC MASS UNITS). PARAMETERS ANALYZED IN REACTION GAS {H2} MODE, [SE(77)] ONLY; IN COLLISION GAS {HE} MODE INCLUDE [AL(27), AS(75), B(11), CA(43), CO(59), CR(52), CU(65), FE(56), K(39), MG(26), MN(55), NA(23), NI(60), P(31), SC(45), SR(86), TI(47), V(51), ZN(66), ZR(90)]); IN COLLISION GAS {XE} MODE [S(32)] ONLY; AND IN NORMAL NO GAS MODE INCLUDE [AG(107), BA(135), BE(9), BI(209), CD(111), CE(140), CS(133), GA(71), GD(160), LA(139), LI(7), MO(98), NB(93), PB(208), PD(106), PT(195), RB(85), RH(103), SB(121), SN(120), TI(205), U(238), W(184), Y(89)]. THE RESULTS ARE REPORTED ON A DRY WEIGHT BASIS. NLET, BURLINGTON, METHOD 02-2405. REQUESTED DECEMBER 2010. THE METHOD IS MODIFIED FROM EPA METHOD NUMBER 2052.

EACH RESPECTIVE ELEMENT IS MEASURED AT A SPECIFIC MASS TO CHARGE RATIO, M/Z VALUE EXPRESSED IN AMU (ATOMIC MASS UNITS). PARAMETERS ANALYZED IN REACTION GAS {H2} MODE, [SE(77)] ONLY; IN COLLISION GAS {HE} MODE INCLUDE [AL(27), AS(75), B(11), CA(43), CO(59), CR(52), CU(65), FE(56), K(39), MG(26), MN(55), NA(23), NI(60), P(31), SC(45), SR(86), TI(47), V(51), ZN(66), ZR(90)]); IN COLLISION GAS {XE} MODE [S(32)] ONLY; AND IN NORMAL NO GAS MODE INCLUDE [AG(107), BA(135), BE(9), BI(209), CD(111), CE(140), CS(133), GA(71), GD(160), LA(139), LI(7), MO(98), NB(93), PB(208), PD(106), PT(195), RB(85), RH(103), SB(121), SN(120), TI(205), U(238), W(184), Y(89)]. TOTAL METALS IN SEDIMENT, BY MICROWAVE ASSISTED ACID DIGESTION INCLUDING HF - TOTAL METALS ANALYSIS REQUIRES THE COMPLETE DESTRUCTION OF THE SAMPLE IN ORDER TO RELEASE ALL FORMS OF METAL. THE PROCEDURE, IS A MODIFICATION OF ENVIRODAT METHOD 2940 AND IS DESCRIBED AS FOLLOWS: ONE-HALF GRAM OF FREEZE DRIED SEDIMENT IS WEIGHED INTO A TFM TEFLON VESSEL AND A MIXTURE OF NITRIC ACID, HYDROCHLORIC ACID AND HYDROGEN PEROXIDE (9:2:1 ML) IS ADDED. THE VESSEL IS ASSEMBLED, SEALED AND FITTED ONTO A MICROWAVE ROTOR WHICH IS PLACED IN A HIGH PRESSURE MICROWAVE OVEN. THE SAMPLE IS DIGESTED AND THE TEMPERATURE IS MAINTAINED AT 200o C FOR 15 MINUTES. THE VESSEL IS REMOVED FROM THE MICROWAVE OVEN AND THE COOLED DIGEST IS TRANSFERRED TO A TEFLON DIGESTION TUBE. THE SAMPLE VOLUME IS THEN REDUCED ON A HOT BLOCK AT 130o C TO NEAR DRYNESS (~1 ML), FOLLOWED BY TREATMENT WITH 10 ML HYDROFLUORIC ACID, OVERNIGHT AT 90o C, TO ENSURE DESTRUCTION OF SILICATES. THE EXCESS HYDROFLUORIC ACID IS BOILED OFF AND THE SALTS ARE DISSOLVED IN A SOLUTION OF 5% HYDROCHLORIC ACID. EACH RESPECTIVE ELEMENT IS MEASURED AT A SPECIFIC MASS TO CHARGE RATIO, M/Z VALUE EXPRESSED IN AMU (ATOMIC MASS UNITS). TOTAL METALS IN SEDIMENT, BY MICROWAVE ASSISTED ACID DIGESTION INCLUDING HF - TOTAL METALS ANALYSIS REQUIRES THE COMPLETE DESTRUCTION OF THE SAMPLE IN ORDER TO RELEASE ALL FORMS OF METAL. THE PROCEDURE, IS A MODIFICATION OF ENVIRODAT METHOD 2940 AND IS DESCRIBED AS FOLLOWS: ONE-HALF GRAM OF FREEZE DRIED SEDIMENT IS WEIGHED INTO A TFM TEFLON VESSEL AND A MIXTURE OF NITRIC ACID, HYDROCHLORIC ACID AND HYDROGEN PEROXIDE (9:2:1 ML) IS ADDED. THE VESSEL IS ASSEMBLED, SEALED AND FITTED ONTO A MICROWAVE ROTOR WHICH IS PLACED IN A HIGH PRESSURE MICROWAVE OVEN. THE SAMPLE IS DIGESTED AND THE TEMPERATURE IS MAINTAINED AT 200o C FOR 15 MINUTES. THE VESSEL IS REMOVED FROM THE MICROWAVE OVEN AND THE COOLED DIGEST IS TRANSFERRED TO A TEFLON DIGESTION TUBE. THE SAMPLE VOLUME IS THEN REDUCED ON A HOT BLOCK AT 130o C TO NEAR DRYNESS (~1 ML), FOLLOWED BY TREATMENT WITH 10 ML HYDROFLUORIC ACID, OVERNIGHT AT 90o C, TO ENSURE DESTRUCTION OF SILICATES. THE EXCESS HYDROFLUORIC ACID IS BOILED OFF AND THE SALTS ARE DISSOLVED IN A SOLUTION OF 5% HYDROCHLORIC ACID. THE 100 ML RESULTANT SOLUTION IS DILUTED APPROPRIATELY AND ANALYZED BY AN INDUCTIVELY COUPLED ARGON PLASMA- COLLISION/REACTION CELL MASS SPECTROMETER (CRC-ICP-MS) USING DISCRETE SAMPLING PNUEMATIC NEBULIZATION. EACH RESPECTIVE ELEMENT IS MEASURED AT A SPECIFIC MASS TO CHARGE RATIO, M/Z VALUE EXPRESSED IN AMU (ATOMIC MASS UNITS). PARAMETERS ANALYZED IN REACTION GAS {H2} MODE, [SE(77)] ONLY; IN COLLISION GAS {HE} MODE INCLUDE [AL(27), AS(75), B(11), CA(43), CO(59), CR(52), CU(65), FE(56), K(39), MG(26), MN(55), NA(23), NI(60), P(31), SC(45), SR(86), TI(47), V(51), ZN(66), ZR(90)]); IN COLLISION GAS {XE} MODE [S(32)] ONLY; AND IN NORMAL NO GAS MODE INCLUDE [AG(107), BA(135), BE(9), BI(209), CD(111), CE(140), CS(133), GA(71), GD(160), LA(139), LI(7), MO(98), NB(93), PB(208), PD(106), PT(195), RB(85), RH(103), SB(121), SN(120), TI(205), U(238), W(184), Y(89)]. THE RESULTS ARE REPORTED ON A DRY WEIGHT BASIS. NLET, BURLINGTON, METHOD 02-2405. REQUESTED DECEMBER 2010. THE METHOD IS MODIFIED FROM EPA METHOD NUMBER 2052.

THE VESSEL IS ASSEMBLED, SEALED AND FITTED ONTO A MICROWAVE ROTOR WHICH IS PLACED IN A HIGH PRESSURE MICROWAVE OVEN. THE SAMPLE IS DIGESTED AND THE TEMPERATURE IS MAINTAINED AT 200o C FOR 15 MINUTES. THE VESSEL IS REMOVED FROM THE MICROWAVE OVEN AND THE COOLED DIGEST IS TRANSFERRED TO A TEFLON DIGESTION TUBE. THE SAMPLE VOLUME IS THEN REDUCED ON A HOT BLOCK AT 130o C TO NEAR DRYNESS (~1 ML), FOLLOWED BY TREATMENT WITH 10 ML HYDROFLUORIC ACID, OVERNIGHT AT 90o C, TO ENSURE DESTRUCTION OF SILICATES. THE EXCESS HYDROFLUORIC ACID IS BOILED OFF AND THE SALTS ARE DISSOLVED IN A SOLUTION OF 5% HYDROCHLORIC ACID. THE 100 ML RESULTANT SOLUTION IS DILUTED APPROPRIATELY AND ANALYZED BY AN INDUCTIVELY COUPLED ARGON PLASMA- COLLISION/REACTION CELL MASS SPECTROMETER (CRC-ICP-MS) USING DISCRETE SAMPLING PNUEMATIC NEBULIZATION. EACH RESPECTIVE ELEMENT IS MEASURED AT A SPECIFIC MASS TO CHARGE RATIO, M/Z VALUE EXPRESSED IN AMU (ATOMIC MASS UNITS). PARAMETERS ANALYZED IN REACTION GAS {H2} MODE, [SE(77)] ONLY; IN COLLISION GAS {HE} MODE INCLUDE [AL(27), AS(75), B(11), CA(43), CO(59), CR(52), CU(65), FE(56), K(39), MG(26), MN(55), NA(23), NI(60), P(31), SC(45), SR(86), TI(47), V(51), ZN(66), ZR(90)]); IN COLLISION GAS {XE} MODE [S(32)] ONLY; AND IN NORMAL NO GAS MODE INCLUDE [AG(107), BA(135), BE(9), BI(209), CD(111), CE(140), CS(133), GA(71), GD(160), LA(139), LI(7), MO(98), NB(93), PB(208), PD(106), PT(195), RB(85), RH(103), SB(121), SN(120), TI(205), U(238), W(184), Y(89)]. THE RESULTS ARE REPORTED ON A DRY WEIGHT BASIS. NLET, BURLINGTON, METHOD 02-2405. REQUESTED DECEMBER 2010. THE METHOD IS MODIFIED FROM EPA METHOD NUMBER 2052.

EACH RESPECTIVE ELEMENT IS MEASURED AT A SPECIFIC MASS TO CHARGE RATIO, M/Z VALUE EXPRESSED IN AMU (ATOMIC MASS UNITS). PARAMETERS ANALYZED IN REACTION GAS {H2} MODE, [SE(77)] ONLY; IN COLLISION GAS {HE} MODE INCLUDE [AL(27), AS(75), B(11), CA(43), CO(59), CR(52), CU(65), FE(56), K(39), MG(26), MN(55), NA(23), NI(60), P(31), SC(45), SR(86), TI(47), V(51), ZN(66), ZR(90)]); IN COLLISION GAS {XE} MODE [S(32)] ONLY; AND IN NORMAL NO GAS MODE INCLUDE [AG(107), BA(135), BE(9), BI(209), CD(111), CE(140), CS(133), GA(71), GD(160), LA(139), LI(7), MO(98), NB(93), PB(208), PD(106), PT(195), RB(85), RH(103), SB(121), SN(120), TI(205), U(238), W(184), Y(89)]. THE RESULTS ARE REPORTED ON A DRY WEIGHT BASIS. NLET, BURLINGTON, METHOD 02-2405. REQUESTED DECEMBER 2010. THE METHOD IS MODIFIED FROM EPA METHOD NUMBER 2052.

TOTAL METALS IN SEDIMENT, BY MICROWAVE ASSISTED ACID DIGESTION INCLUDING HF - TOTAL METALS ANALYSIS REQUIRES THE COMPLETE DESTRUCTION OF THE SAMPLE IN ORDER TO RELEASE ALL FORMS OF METAL. THE PROCEDURE, IS A MODIFICATION OF ENVIRODAT METHOD 2940 AND IS DESCRIBED AS FOLLOWS: ONE-HALF GRAM OF FREEZE DRIED SEDIMENT IS WEIGHED INTO A TFM TEFLON VESSEL AND A MIXTURE OF NITRIC ACID, HYDROCHLORIC ACID AND HYDROGEN PEROXIDE (9:2:1 ML) IS ADDED. THE VESSEL IS ASSEMBLED, SEALED AND FITTED ONTO A MICROWAVE ROTOR WHICH IS PLACED IN A HIGH PRESSURE MICROWAVE OVEN. THE SAMPLE IS DIGESTED AND THE TEMPERATURE IS MAINTAINED AT 200o C FOR 15 MINUTES. THE VESSEL IS REMOVED FROM THE MICROWAVE OVEN AND THE COOLED DIGEST IS TRANSFERRED TO A TEFLON DIGESTION TUBE. THE SAMPLE VOLUME IS THEN REDUCED ON A HOT BLOCK AT 130o C TO NEAR DRYNESS (~1 ML), FOLLOWED BY TREATMENT WITH 10 ML HYDROFLUORIC ACID, OVERNIGHT AT 90o C, TO ENSURE DESTRUCTION OF SILICATES. THE EXCESS HYDROFLUORIC ACID IS BOILED OFF AND THE SALTS ARE DISSOLVED IN A SOLUTION OF 5% HYDROCHLORIC ACID. EACH RESPECTIVE ELEMENT IS MEASURED AT A SPECIFIC MASS TO CHARGE RATIO, M/Z VALUE EXPRESSED IN AMU (ATOMIC MASS UNITS). PARAMETERS ANALYZED IN REACTION GAS {H2} MODE, [SE(77)] ONLY; IN COLLISION GAS {HE} MODE INCLUDE [AL(27), AS(75), B(11), CA(43), CO(59), CR(52), CU(65), FE(56), K(39), MG(26), MN(55), NA(23), NI(60), P(31), SC(45), SR(86), TI(47), V(51), ZN(66), ZR(90)]); IN COLLISION GAS {XE} MODE [S(32)] ONLY; AND IN NORMAL NO GAS MODE INCLUDE [AG(107), BA(135), BE(9), BI(209), CD(111), CE(140), CS(133), GA(71), GD(160), LA(139), LI(7), MO(98), NB(93), PB(208), PD(106), PT(195), RB(85), RH(103), SB(121), SN(120), TI(205), U(238), W(184), Y(89)]. METALS IN WATER, TOTAL, "IN-BOTTLE" DIGESTION, ICP-MS:  The whole water sample collected in a HDPE or Teflon bottle , is de-capped in a Class 100 Workstation , acidified to 2%(v/v) HNO3 and recapped. The sample is "in-bottle" digested in a convection oven , set at 65 degrees C for 16 hours (overnight). The sample is cooled and introduced to an inductively coupled argon plasma- collision/reaction cell mass spectrometer ( CRC-ICP-MS ) by discrete sampling pnuematic nebulization. Each respective element is measured at a specific mass to charge ratio, m/z value expressed in amu (atomic mass units). Parameters analyzed in reaction gas [H2] mode, [Se(77)] only , in collision gas [He] mode include   [Al(27), As(75), B(11), Co(59), Cr(52), Cu(65), Fe(56), Mn(55), Ni(60) , Sr(86), Ti(47), V(51), and Zn(66)] and in normal mode include  [Ag(107), Ba(135), Be(9), Bi(209), Cd(111), Ce(140), Cs(133) , Ga(71), La(139), Li(7), Mo(98),  Nb(93), Pb(208), Pd(106), Pt(195), Rb(85), Sb (121), Sn(120), Tl(205), U(238), W(184), Y(89)].  NLET , Burlington, Method 02-2004.  Requested June 2011.

METALS IN WATER, TOTAL, "IN-BOTTLE" DIGESTION, ICP-MS:  The whole water sample collected in a HDPE or Teflon bottle , is de-capped in a Class 100 Workstation , acidified to 2%(v/v) HNO3 and recapped. The sample is "in-bottle" digested in a convection oven , set at 65 degrees C for 16 hours (overnight). The sample is cooled and introduced to an inductively coupled argon plasma- collision/reaction cell mass spectrometer ( CRC-ICP-MS ) by discrete sampling pnuematic nebulization. Each respective element is measured at a specific mass to charge ratio, m/z value expressed in amu (atomic mass units). The container is de-capped in a Class 100 Workstation, acidified to 2%(v/v) HNO3 and recapped. The sample is "in-bottle" digested in a convection oven , set at 65 degrees C for 16 hours (overnight). The sample is cooled and introduced to an inductively coupled argon plasma- collision/reaction cell mass spectrometer ( CRC-ICP-MS ) by discrete sampling pnuematic nebulization. Each respective element  is measured at a specific mass to charge ratio, m/z value expressed in amu(atomic mass units). Parameters analyzed in reaction gas [H2] mode, [Se(77)] only, in collision gas [He] mode include   [Al(27), As(75), B(11), Co(59), Cr(52), Cu(65), Fe(56), Mn(55), Ni (60), Sr(86), Ti(47), V(51), and Zn(66)] and in normal mode include  [Ag(107), Ba(135), Be(9), Bi(209), Cd(111), Ce(140), Cs(133), Ga (71), La(139), Li(7), Mo(98), Nb(93), Pb(208), Pd(106), Pt(195), Rb(85), Sb (121), Sn(120), Tl(205), U(238), W(184), Y(89)].  NLET, Burlington, Method 02-2004. Requested June 2011.

DETERMINATION OF MOISTURE CONTENT IN SOLIDS - A wet blended solid (sediment, soil, sluge, biota etc.) is frozen to minus 20 degrees Celcius,  placed in a freeze drier, and dried to constant weight. The difference between the wet sample weight and the dry sample weight is used to calculate the % moisture.   NLET , Burlington.  Requested August 2011.

DETERMINATION OF MOISTURE CONTENT IN SOLIDS - A wet blended solid (sediment, soil, sluge, biota etc.) is frozen to minus 20 degrees Celcius,  placed in a freeze drier, and dried to constant weight. The difference between the wet sample weight and the dry sample weight is used to calculate the % moisture.   NLET , Burlington.  Requested August 2011.

A 1L water sample is acidified to pH<2 with 50% sulphuric acid and extracted with dichloromethane. The extract is concentrated and the residue reacted with 5% (v/v) pentafluorobenzyl bromide (PFBBr) to form the PFB ester. Silica gel column clean-up is used to remove non-targeted substrates and unreacted PFBBr.  The PFBBr esters are eluted and collected into two fractions.  Acidic pharmaceutical esters are measured using gas capillary chromatography and NICI-0MS detection.

PHOSPHOROUS SOLUBLE REACTIVE, CFA, ASCORBIC ACID, MOLYBDATE COMPLEX - A whole water sample is filtered through a 0.45 um cellulose acetate membrane filter. The filtrate is analyzed in a continuous flow analyzer (CFA) where the dissolved orthophosphate present (PO4) in the sample is reacted in an acid medium with ammonium molybdate and antimony potassium tartrate to form antimony-phosphomolybdate acid. This is then reduced with ascorbic acid to form the molybdenum blue complex. The absorption of radiation by the complex is proportional to the soluable reactive phosphorous concentration in the sample and is determined by the CFA photometer at 880 nm wavelength. 				
Reference Method.  Standard Methods for the Examination of Water and Wastewater, 21st Edition, 4500P-F.  NLET , Burlington, Method 01-1201. Requested December 2011.

PHOSPHOROUS SOLUBLE REACTIVE, CFA, ASCORBIC ACID, MOLYBDATE COMPLEX - A whole water sample is filtered through a 0.45 um cellulose acetate membrane filter. The filtrate is analyzed in a continuous flow analyzer (CFA) where the dissolved orthophosphate present (PO4) in the sample is reacted in an acid medium with ammonium molybdate and antimony potassium tartrate to form antimony-phosphomolybdate acid. This is then reduced with ascorbic acid to form the molybdenum blue complex. The absorption of radiation by the complex is proportional to the soluable reactive phosphorous concentration in the sample and is determined by the CFA photometer at 880 nm wavelength. 				
Reference Method.  Standard Methods for the Examination of Water and Wastewater, 21st Edition, 4500P-F.  NLET , Burlington, Method 01-1201. Requested December 2011.

PHOSPHOROUS  SOLUBLE  REACTIVE, CFA, ASCORBIC ACID, MOLYBDATE COMPLEX, UNFILTERD (DECANTED) - A whole water sample is decanted into a continuous flow analyzer (CFA) sampler cup. In the analyzer the dissolved orthophosphate present (PO4) in the sample is reacted in an acid medium with ammonium molybdate and antimony potassium tartrate to form antimony-phosphomolybdate acid. This is then reduced with ascorbic acid to form the molybdenum blue complex. The absorption of radiation by the complex is proportional to the soluable reactive phosphorous concentration in the sample and is determined by the CFA photometer at 880 nm wavelength. Reference Method.  Standard Methods for the Examination of Water and Wastewater, 21st Edition, 4500P-F.  NLET , Burlington, Method 01-1201.  Requested December 2011. Results, although not identical, should be comparable to filtered samples.

PHOSPHOROUS  SOLUBLE  REACTIVE, CFA, ASCORBIC ACID, MOLYBDATE COMPLEX, UNFILTERD (DECANTED) - A whole water sample is decanted into a continuous flow analyzer (CFA) sampler cup. In the analyzer the dissolved orthophosphate present (PO4) in the sample is reacted in an acid medium with ammonium molybdate and antimony potassium tartrate to form antimony-phosphomolybdate acid. This is then reduced with ascorbic acid to form the molybdenum blue complex. The absorption of radiation by the complex is proportional to the soluable reactive phosphorous concentration in the sample and is determined by the CFA photometer at 880 nm wavelength. Reference Method.  Standard Methods for the Examination of Water and Wastewater, 21st Edition, 4500P-F.  NLET , Burlington, Method 01-1201.  Requested December 2011. TOTAL NITROGEN DISSOLVED, FIA, HYDRAZINE, AZO DYE PHOTOMETRIC METHOD. A whole water sample is filtered through a 0.45 um cellulose acetate membrane filter. Organic and inorganic nitrogen compounds in the filtered sample are oxidized to nitrate during digestion in an autoclave (121oC) with alkaline potassium persulfate.  The digest is then analyzed in a flow injection analyzer (FIA), where the reduction of nitrate to nitrite is accomplished by means of an alkaline hydrazine sulphate solution containing a copper catalyst. The nitrites are reacted under acidic  conditions with sulphanilamide (NH2C6H4SO2NH2) to form a diazo compound which is then coupled with N-naphthyl)-ethylenediamine dihydochloride (C12H16C12N2) to form a reddish-purple azo dye.  The absorption of  radiation by the dye is proportional to the total dissolved nitrogen concentration in the filtered sample and is determined by the FIA photometer at 520 nm wavelength. NLET Method 01-1151,  Burlington.   Requested January 2012. Reference Method:  Standard Methods for the Examination of Water and Wastewater, 21st Edition, 4500-N C and 4500-NO3- H.

A large volume water sample is acidified to pH2 with 50% (v/v) sulphuric acid and extracted with dichloromethane (CH2CL2). The extract is concentrated and the residue reacted with 5% (v/v) PFBBr (pentafluorobenzyl bromide) to form the PFB esters. Silica gel column cleanup is used to remove non-targeted substrates and unreacted PFBBr. The PFBBr esters are eluted and collected in one fraction. Acid herbicide esters are measured using Gas Chromatography and Negative Ion Chemical Ionization Mass Spectrometry (GC/NICIMS) detection.

TOTAL PHOSPHOROUS UNFILTERED, ACIDIC PERSULPHATE OXIDATION,  CFA,  ASCORBIC ACID, MOLYBDENUM BLUE, COLORIMETRIC METHOD - A whole water sample is collected in a 125 mL flint glass bottle and preserved with sulphuric acid to a pH of < 2. The sample is shaken, a 10 mL aliquot is poured in a glass digestion tube and a mixture of sulphuric acid/persulfate is added.  The sample is then digested in an autoclave for 30 minutes at 121oC. The oxidative-acid digestion releases organically bound phosphorous as orthophosphate, PO4. Orthophosphate is also formed in the digestion from the hydrolysis of inorganic condensed phosphorous (pyro-, meta-, and other polyphosphates).The digest is analyzed in a continuous segmented flow analyzer (CFA) where the orthophosphate is reacted in an acid medium with ammonium molybdate and potassium antimonyl tartrate to form antimony-phosphomolybdate acid. This is then reduced with ascorbic acid to form the molybdenum blue complex. The absorption of radiation by the complex is proportional to  the total phosphorous concentration in the sample  and is determined by the CFA colorimeter at 880 nm wavelength. Quantification is achieved  by calibration of the colorimeter with known solutions of phosphorous standards spread across the analytical range.			
NLET Method 01-1191, Burlington. Commenced  April 1, 2013. , Requested February 2013. Reference Method: Standard Methods for the Examination of Water and WasteWater, 21st Edition, 4500-P B(Section 5) + 4500-P F

The sample is shaken, a 10 mL aliquot is poured in a glass digestion tube and a mixture of sulphuric acid/persulfate is added.  The sample is then digested in an autoclave for 30 minutes at 121oC. TOTAL PHOSPHOROUS FILTERED,ACIDIC PERSULPHATE OXIDATION,  CFA,  ASCORBIC ACID, MOLYBDENUM BLUE, COLORIMETRIC METHOD - A whole water sample is filtered through a 0.45 um cellulose acetate membrane filter. The filtrate is placed in a 125 mL flint glass bottle and preserved with sulphuric acid to a pH of < 2.  A 10 mL aliquot is poured in a glass digestion tube and  a mixture of sulphuric acid/persulfate  is added. The sample is then digested in an autoclave for 30 minutes at 121oC.  The oxidative-acid digestion releases organically bound phosphorous as orthophosphate, PO4. Orthophosphate is also formed in the digestion from the hydrolysis of inorganic condensed phosphorous (pyro-, meta-, and other polyphosphates). The digest is analyzed in a continuous segmented flow analyzer (CFA) where the orthophosphate is reacted in an acid medium with ammonium molybdate and potassium antimonyl tartrate to form antimony-phosphomolybdate acid. This is then reduced with ascorbic acid to form the molybdenum blue complex. The absorption of radiation by the complex is proportional to the total phosphorous concentration in the sample  and is determined by the CFA  colorimeter at 880 nm wavelength. Quantification is achieved  by calibration of the colorimeter with known solutions of	phosphorous standards spread across the analytical range.  
NLET Method 01-1191, Burlington.  Commenced April 1, 2013. Requested February 2013. Reference Method: Standard Methods for the Examination of Water and Wastewater, 21st Edition, 4500-P B(Section 5) + 4500-P F

TOTAL PHOSPHOROUS FILTERED,ACIDIC PERSULPHATE OXIDATION,  CFA,  ASCORBIC ACID, MOLYBDENUM BLUE, COLORIMETRIC METHOD - A whole water sample is filtered through a 0.45 um cellulose acetate membrane filter. TOTAL  PARTICULATE PHOSPHOROUS, ACIDIC PERSULPHATE OXIDATION,  CFA,  ASCORBIC ACID, MOLYBDENUM BLUE, COLORIMETRIC METHOD - A known volume of a whole water sample is filtered through a 0.45 um cellulose acetate filter paper. The filter with the contained solids is placed in a sample container 	
(100 mL flint glass bottle), and 100 mL phosphorus free water is added. It is preserved by adding 1.0 mL of 30% sulphuric acid solution. In the laboratory, 300 uL of saturated potassium persulphate solution is added. It is then digested in an autoclave for 30 minutes at 121 C and 20 PSI. The oxidative-acid digestion releases organically 	
bound (pyro-, meta-, and other polyphosphates). The digest is analyzed in a continuous segmented flow analyzer (CFA) where the orthophosphate is reacted in an acid medium with ammonium molybdate and potassium antimonyl tartrate to form antimony-phosphomolybdate acid. This is then reduced with ascorbic acid to form the molybdenum blue complex.  The absorption of radiation by the complex is proportional to  the total phosphorous concentration in the sample  and is determined by the CFA  colorimeter at 880 nm wavelength.  Quantification is achieved  by calibration of the colorimeter with known solutions of phosphorous standards spread across the analytical range. NLET Method 01-1191, Burlington. Commenced April 1, 2013.  Requested February 2013. Reference Method: Standard Methods for the Examination of  Water and Wastewater, 21st Edition, 4500-P B(Section 5) + 4500-P F.

TOTAL  PARTICULATE PHOSPHOROUS, ACIDIC PERSULPHATE OXIDATION,  CFA,  ASCORBIC ACID, MOLYBDENUM BLUE, COLORIMETRIC METHOD - A known volume of a whole water sample is filtered through a 0.45 um cellulose acetate filter paper. The filter with the contained solids is placed in a sample container 	
(100 mL flint glass bottle), and 100 mL phosphorus free water is added. It is preserved by adding 1.0 mL of 30% sulphuric acid solution. In the laboratory, 300 uL of saturated potassium persulphate solution is added. It is then digested in an autoclave for 30 minutes at 121 C and 20 PSI. The oxidative-acid digestion releases organically 	
bound (pyro-, meta-, and other polyphosphates). The digest is analyzed in a continuous segmented flow analyzer (CFA) where the orthophosphate is reacted in an acid medium with ammonium molybdate and potassium antimonyl tartrate to form antimony-phosphomolybdate acid. This is then reduced with ascorbic acid to form the molybdenum blue complex.  The absorption of radiation by the complex is proportional to  the total phosphorous concentration in the sample  and is determined by the CFA  colorimeter at 880 nm wavelength.  Quantification is achieved  by calibration of the colorimeter with known solutions of phosphorous standards spread across the analytical range. NLET Method 01-1191, Burlington. Commenced April 1, 2013.  Requested February 2013. Reference Method: Standard Methods for the Examination of  Water and Wastewater, 21st Edition, 4500-P B(Section 5) + 4500-P F.

CATIONS, FILTERED,DIRECT ANALYSIS, INDUCTIVELY COUPLED PLASMA-OPTICAL EMISSION SPECTROMETRY METHOD - A whole water sample is filtered through a 0.45 um cellulose acetate membrane filter.The filtrate is placed in a 100 mL high density polyethlene bottle.  An aliqout of the filtrate is analyzed by an Inductively Coupled Plasm-Optical Emission Spectrometer (ICP-OES).  The sample is  introduced as a fine aerosol to the instrument plasma by pneumatic nebulisation where energy tranfer processes causes desolvation, atomization and ionization.   Excitation of the atoms and ions occurs within the plasma. They will then decay to thier lower more stable states and an emission spectra characteristic of the elements  is produced.  A diffraction grating is used by the instrument to disperse the spectra and the intensities of the lines for the elements of interest  are captured by a CCD detector. The emission of radiation is proportional to  the analyte's concentration in the sample. Quantification is achieved  by calibration of the spectrometerr with known solutions of analyte(s) standards spread across the analytical range. Typical line wavelengths include  317.9 nm for Ca, 766.5 nm for K, 285.2 nm for Mg , 589.6 for Na,  and 251.6 nm for silcon (as silca, SiO2). NLET Method 01-1162, Commenced April 1, 2013. Burlington, Requested February 2013. Reference Method: Standard Methods for the Examination of Water and Wastewater, 21st Edition, 3120 B.

CATIONS, FILTERED,DIRECT ANALYSIS, INDUCTIVELY COUPLED PLASMA-OPTICAL EMISSION SPECTROMETRY METHOD - A whole water sample is filtered through a 0.45 um cellulose acetate membrane filter.The filtrate is placed in a 100 mL high density polyethlene bottle.  An aliqout of the filtrate is analyzed by an Inductively Coupled Plasm-Optical Emission Spectrometer (ICP-OES).  The sample is  introduced as a fine aerosol to the instrument plasma by pneumatic nebulisation where energy tranfer processes causes desolvation, atomization and ionization.   Excitation of the atoms and ions occurs within the plasma. They will then decay to thier lower more stable states and an emission spectra characteristic of the elements  is produced.  A diffraction grating is used by the instrument to disperse the spectra and the intensities of the lines for the elements of interest  are captured by a CCD detector. The emission of radiation is proportional to  the analyte's concentration in the sample. Quantification is achieved  by calibration of the spectrometerr with known solutions of analyte(s) standards spread across the analytical range. Typical line wavelengths include  317.9 nm for Ca, 766.5 nm for K, 285.2 nm for Mg , 589.6 for Na,  and 251.6 nm for silcon (as silca, SiO2). NLET Method 01-1162, Commenced April 1, 2013. Burlington, Requested February 2013. Reference Method: Standard Methods for the Examination of Water and Wastewater, 21st Edition, 3120 B.

TOTAL  PARTICULATE PHOSPHOROUS, ACIDIC PERSULPHATE OXIDATION, CFA, ASCORBIC ACID, MOLYBDENUM BLUE, COLORIMETRIC METHOD: A known volume of a whole water sample is filtered through a GF/C glass fiber filter paper. The filter with the contained solids is placed in a sample container (100 mL flint glass bottle), and 100 mL phosphorus free water is added. It is preserved by adding 1.0 mL of 30% sulphuric acid solution. In the laboratory, 300 uL of saturated potassium persulphate solution is added. It is then digested in an autoclave for 30 minutes at 121 C and 20 PSI. The oxidative-acid digestion releases organically bound (pyro-, meta-, and other polyphosphates). The digest is analyzed in a continuous segmented flow analyzer (CFA) where the orthophosphate is reacted in an acid medium with ammonium molybdate and potassium antimonyl tartrate  to form antimony-phosphomolybdate acid.  This is then reduced with ascorbic acid to form the molybdenum blue complex.  The absorption of radiation by the complex is proportional to  the total phosphorous concentration in the sample  and is determined by the CFA  colorimeter at 880 nm wavelength.  Quantification is achieved  by calibration of the colorimeter with known solutions of phosphorous standards spread across the analytical range. NLET Method 01-1191, Burlington. Commenced April 1, 2013.  Requested February 2013. Reference Method: Standard Methods for the Examination of  Water and Wastewater, 21st Edition, 4500-P B(Section 5) + 4500-P F.

TOTAL  PARTICULATE PHOSPHOROUS, ACIDIC PERSULPHATE OXIDATION, CFA, ASCORBIC ACID, MOLYBDENUM BLUE, COLORIMETRIC METHOD: A known volume of a whole water sample is filtered through a GF/C glass fiber filter paper. The filter with the contained solids is placed in a sample container (100 mL flint glass bottle), and 100 mL phosphorus free water is added. It is preserved by adding 1.0 mL of 30% sulphuric acid solution. In the laboratory, 300 uL of saturated potassium persulphate solution is added. It is then digested in an autoclave for 30 minutes at 121 C and 20 PSI. The oxidative-acid digestion releases organically bound (pyro-, meta-, and other polyphosphates). The digest is analyzed in a continuous segmented flow analyzer (CFA) where the orthophosphate is reacted in an acid medium with ammonium molybdate and potassium antimonyl tartrate to form antimony-phosphomolybdate acid.  This is then reduced with ascorbic acid to form the molybdenum blue complex.  The absorption of radiation by the complex is proportional to  the total phosphorous concentration in the sample  and is determined by the CFA  colorimeter at 880 nm wavelength.  Quantification is achieved  by calibration of the colorimeter with known solutions of phosphorous standards spread across the analytical range. NLET Method 01-1191, Burlington. Commenced April 1, 2013.  Requested February 2013. Reference Method: Standard Methods for the Examination of  Water and Wastewater, 21st Edition, 4500-P B(Section 5) + 4500-P F.

Seven neonicotinoid insecticides in water were simultaneously extracted by an automated Autotrace SPE Workstation.  A sample volume of 900 mL is loaded onto a Waters OASIS-HLB SPE cartridge at a flow rate of 5mL/min, dried with nitrogen for 1 minute and eluted with 10mL of methanol.  The extract is then concentrated to 1.45 mL using nitrogen and 50uL of the internal standard is added to each extract prior to ESI-LC-MS/MS analysis.

1L water samples are extracted through OASIS HLB (6 cc, 500mg) SPE cartridges which are subsequently dried and eluted with methanol.  Extracts are concentrated and subject to the addition of an internal standard containing Linuron-D6, Thifensulfuron-methyl-D3 and Nicosulfuron-D6 before LC-MS/MS analysis The 20 compounds are separated by HPLC and analyzed by a triple-quadrupole mass spectrometer containing an Electrospray Ionization (ESI) source.

Direct injection LC-MS/MS: samples are spiked with an isotopically labeled internal standard, containing 13C labeled triclosan, 13C labeled bisphenol A and deutrerated disperse yellow 3. 90 uL of each sample is injected using a Waters Acquity autosampler, separated using a Waters BEH C18 column (2.1 x 100 mm, 1.7 um particle size) and quantified by a Waters Xevo LC-MS/MS system.

Bromine monochloride (BrCl) is used to oxydize the mercury, a purge and trap methodology using SnCl2+ reduction to convert the ionic Hg2+ into vapor Hg0, followed by gas purging with argon.  Mercury is then preconcentrate on a gold trap (amalgamation), heated and detected by  atomic fluorescence spectrometric.  The method detection limit is 0.03 ng/L, calculated from a SRM. Ref method EPA 1631 (2002)

Data processing of PCB congeners. Samples extracted by Water Quality Monitoring in a ultra trace environment using liquid/liquid extraction by separatory funnel or large volume extractor (LVX) and further cleaned up by silica gel. Extracts sent to NLET for sample analysis by GC-MS/MS and data processing.

B_Acid Herbicide_SPE: 900 mL of acid herbicide samples are acidified to pH<2 with H2SO4 are extracted through 500 mg Strata-X SPE cartridges and eluted with 50/50 methanol/acetonitrile. They are concentrated to a final volume of 1 mL with the addition of internal standard for LC-MS/MS analysis.

The method involves a derivatization of aqueous samples with 9-fluorenylmethylchloroformate (FMOC) in borate buffer, extraction using SPE columns and detection based on liquid chromatography coupled to electrospray tandem mass spectrometry (LCESI-MS/MS). AXYS Method MLA-054 Rev 05
